Very briefly, the main target behind this life is to worship and obey Allah, your creator in every major and minor detail of your life. If you do this you will be rewarded by eternal paradise in the Last
Day. And if you don’t, you will be punished by Hellfire according to
your sins.
[He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving"

chunks.answer:
Allah is the creator, the owner and the controller of all humans and everything in this universe.
"He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him."

He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: How does He look like? When did He come into being? Where did He come from? Who are his family?
chunks.answer:
There is nothing like Him. He is different from all what you can ever imagine. He do not look like any of His creatures. He has no starting point or end point. He is eternal with no beginning or end. He is not born. He do not beget. He do not have a family or a wife or children. In short, your limited human mind can never encompass or comprehend His Divine Self, His wisdom or even His infinite powers.
He is beyond human senses, mind and imagination. Even the human language will fail to describe Him.
Some Qur'anic verses explain these big facts:
"Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent." Al Ikhlas– no. 112 – verse 1 – 4
"Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.
Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Highest, the Greatest."
Al Baqarah– no.2 – verse 255
" [He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing."
Ash-Shura– no.42 – verse 11

chunks.question: And where is this creator?
chunks.answer:
Allah is in the heavens very high above all his creations, but, at the same time, he is everywhere with his knowledge, might and control. He is very close to everyone with his knowledge mercy and might.
Some Qur’anic verses explain this idea:
"He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed."
Al Furqan– no. 25 – verse 59
"And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein Qaf– No. 50 – verse 16
This Hadith also explains this idea:
Narrated Mu'awiyah b. al-Hakam al-Sulami:
I said: Messenger of Allah, I have a slave girl whom I slapped. This grieved the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). I said to him: Should I not
emancipate her? He said: Bring her to me. He said: Then I brought her. He asked: Where is Allah? She replied: In the heaven. He said: Who am I? She replied: You are the Messenger of Allah. He said: Emancipate her, she is a believer.
Sahih (Al-Albani) - Sunan Abi Dawud 3282 - Book 22, Hadith 41

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: Why don't we see Him with our eyes? I believe only what I see.
chunks.answer:
How do you want to see the creator with your eyes when you cannot see many of his creations with your eyes?
Example 1: you cannot see your soul which gives life and movement to your body. It leaves your body every day when you sleep and comes back when you wake up. And this is happening everyday all through your life. And you or anyone else have never been able to see it or even recognize what it is made of or anything about it.
Example 2: You cannot see very tiny beings like microbes or viruses. You need an expensive microscope that enlarges things thousands of times to be able to see them. These very tiny creatures are created by Allah, but we cannot see them with our naked eyes.
Example 3: the Ultra-sonic waves cannot be heard by the human ears. And it is one of Allah's creations. So, how do you want to hear Allah the creator Himself?
Example4: the sun is one of the creations of Allah. It is bigger than Earth approximately 1 million and 3 hundred thousand times. The temperature on its surface can reach tens of thousands of degrees Celsius. Try to look at the sun with your naked eyes at noon. You can never look more than a few seconds or you will lose your eyesight.
So, if you cannot understand, see or look at many of Allah's creations, for different reasons, how do you want to see the creator Himself?
It is very logical that we cannot see him.
"Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted."
Al An'am– no.6 – verse 103
"And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."
Al A'raf– no. 7 – verse 143

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: But how can I know Him if I cannot see Him or listen to Him?
chunks.answer:
There are two ways to know your creator:
1.	Read and understand Allah's last revelation to humanity. That is, Qur'an. And leave aside any prejudice or wrong information you may have been affected by through the media or any other source. Read it with your common sense and human logic and try to understand the divine logical messages that are very obvious in this book from beginning to end. I am sure you will come to know your creator and learn about some of His logic from this book "Qur'an".
2.	Contemplate and think of his innumerable creatures and blessings in yourself and on earth around you everywhere. And certainly, your sound logic will lead you to know Him very well.

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: Do you think that all these deities worshipped by people everywhere cannot offer any benefit or harm to the worshippers? But there are different gods with different names and stories.
chunks.answer:
Yes, none of these deities can offer any real benefit or cause any harm to those who worship them, regardless of their different names, stories, or forms. This is because they are not true gods in the first place. They neither create nor control anything in existence; rather, they themselves are created and completely powerless.

Allah clearly states this reality in the Qur'an:

"But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection."
Al-Furqan – no. 25 – verse 3

This verse establishes a fundamental criterion for divinity: a true God must be the Creator, fully independent, and possessing absolute power over benefit, harm, life, death, and resurrection. Any being that lacks these attributes can never be worthy of worship.

As for the multiplicity of gods, names, and stories, Allah explains that these so-called deities are nothing more than human inventions passed down through generations without any divine proof:

"They are not but [mere] names you have named them – you and your forefathers – for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance."
An-Najm – no. 53 – verse 23

Thus, the diversity of idols and gods does not indicate truth or power; rather, it reflects human desires, cultural traditions, and assumptions unsupported by revelation. True guidance comes only from Allah, the One Creator, who alone deserves worship.

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: And why did Allah create this entire universe, the heavens, the earth and all the creatures? Why did He create human beings if you were right?
chunks.answer:
Allah created this entire universe, including the heavens, the earth, and all creatures, for a clear, wise, and purposeful reason. The creation was not random, meaningless, or for play. The primary purpose of creating human beings and jinn is clearly stated by Allah Himself:

"And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me. I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me. Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength."
Adh-Dhariyat – no. 51 – verses 56–58

This verse establishes that worship is the core purpose of human existence. Allah does not need His creation in any way; He is completely self-sufficient. Worship benefits the human being, not Allah.

It is important to understand that the word "worship" does not mean only performing rituals such as prayer or fasting. Worship is a comprehensive and all-encompassing concept. It includes obeying Allah and His Messenger in every aspect of life, whether major or minor, outward or inward. It means living according to divine guidance in beliefs, actions, morals, and intentions.

Furthermore, Allah clarifies that the universe itself was created with truth, wisdom, and a fixed purpose:

"We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in truth and [for] a specified term. But those who disbelieve, from that of which they are warned, are turning away."
Al-Ahqaf – no. 46 – verse 3

This confirms that creation has meaning, direction, and an appointed end. Those who deny this purpose turn away from the warning and guidance sent to them. Thus, human life is a test of worship, obedience, and recognition of the Creator, within a universe created with truth and wisdom.

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: But if God created the world and the human beings and everything in this universe, then; Who created God?
chunks.answer:
Your question itself is illogical. It can never be asked because if you assume that God was created. So, there should be another creator? If I tell you that “W” for example created God, You will ask the same question: Who created “W”. If I tell you that “H” created “W”. You will reiterate the
same question: Who created “H”. And the same question will be asked forever. So, Logically, there must be one who started everything and all creatures. This one must be omnipotent and different from anything we know. It is a truism and a very logical assumption. This is our creator.
So, If the creator was started or created. Then He is not God. God can never be started or created like his creations.
If God was created, then, he would be similar to his creatures in their weaknesses. if Allah was created by something or someone, logically, he would be weak and under control from the one who created him. Consequently, He will not be suitable to be a God.
Again, you will ask: Okay, he is the creator, But how he started. Again, I answer: If he was created so he can never be God.
Briefly:
Thinking about the Divine-self of the creator is beyond our limited mind. And it will surely lead to atheism. When Satan urges you to think about Allah's Divine self or what He look like or such questions remember this verse in Qur'an:
"There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing."
Ash-Shura– no. 42 – verse11
Also put this warning from prophet Muhammad into your consideration:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Satan comes to one of you and says, 'Who created so-and-so? 'till he says, 'Who has created your Lord?' So, when he inspires such a question, one should seek refuge with Allah and give up such thoughts."
Sahih al-Bukhari - Book 59, Hadith 85
Note1: Always remember that you can know Allah from his creatures in this universe and from his innumerable creatures and blessings but not from thinking about his divine self which is beyond our minds. It is a very dangerous red-line. It will lead you to nothing. So, beware.
Very briefly, when this question haunts you, say to yourself Automatically:
" Anything who is created is usually weak and limited. God or Allah can never be created or he will be controlled by the one who created him and will never be God"

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: So, what will happen after death?
chunks.answer:
Death is not "nonentity". It is a kind of spiritual life that has its own laws and secrets. People experience a kind of spiritual life in their graves based on their deeds in this life.
The following Hadeeths shed some light on this fact
Narrated Abu Sa`id Al-Khudri:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, When the funeral is ready and the men carry it on their shoulders, if the deceased was righteous it will say, 'Present me (hurriedly),' and if he was not righteous, it will say, 'Woe to it (me)! Where are they taking it (me)?' Its voice is heard by everything except man and if he heard it, he would fall unconscious." Sahih al-Bukhari 1314 - Book 23, Hadith 72
Chapter 70: What Has Been Related About the Punishment In The Grave
Abu Hurairah narrated that:
The Messenger of Allah said: "When the deceased - or he said when one of you - is buried, two angels, black and blue (eyed_ come to him. One of them is called Al-Munkar, and the other An-Nakir. They say: 'What did you use to say about this man?' So he says what he was saying (before death) 'He is Allah's slave and His Messenger. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.' So they say: 'We knew that you would say this.' Then his grave is expanded to seventy by seventy cubits, then it is illuminated for him. Then it is said to him: 'Sleep.' So he said: 'Can I return to my family to inform them?' They say: 'Sleep as a newlywed, whom none awakens but the dearest of his family.' Until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."If he was a hypocrite he would say: 'I heard people saying something, so I said the same; I do not know.' So they said: 'We knew you would say that.' So the earth is told: 'Constrict him.' So it constricts around him, squeezing his ribs together. He continues being punished like that until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."
Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1071- Book 10, Hadith 107
"And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on. And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will
not be wronged. And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.
AzZumar– no. 39 – verse 68 – 70

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: And can Allah really resurrect all the billions of people who died hundreds and thousands of years ago? They are billions of people whose bodies are worn out. Nothing is left from them. Can Allah really resurrect them again, evaluate their deeds and grant them eternal life in Paradise or Hellfire?
chunks.answer:
Yes, Allah is absolutely able to resurrect all human beings, regardless of how long they have been dead or how much their bodies have decayed. The disintegration of bodies and the passage of time do not diminish Allah’s power in the slightest. The One who created human beings the first time from nothing is surely able to recreate them again.

Allah directly addresses this doubt in the Qur'an, exposing the inconsistency of such thinking:

"Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop – then at once he is a clear adversary? And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, 'Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?'"

Allah then gives the decisive answer:

"Say, 'He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing.'"

Allah further illustrates His absolute power through signs that humans witness every day:

"[It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite. Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator. His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, 'Be,' and it is. So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned."
Ya-Sin – no. 36 – verses 77–83

These verses make it clear that resurrection is not difficult for Allah. Creating the heavens and the earth is far greater than recreating human beings, yet Allah accomplished it effortlessly. For Allah, creation and recreation are equally easy, as everything occurs by His command alone.

This meaning is further emphasized in another verse:

"And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is [even] easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attribute in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
Ar-Rum – no. 30 – verse 27

Therefore, resurrection, judgment, and eternal life in Paradise or Hellfire are not only possible but inevitable. Denying resurrection is a result of forgetting one’s own origin and underestimating the power of the Creator, while Allah’s ability encompasses all things without limit.

metadata.category: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.

chunks.type: Questions about the existence of God and the logic behind life, death, Resurrection and the Final Judgment Day.
chunks.question: How can I be sure 100% that there will be another eternal life after death and eternal paradise and eternal hellfire while I have no clear evidence for this?
chunks.answer:
"And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation.
He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are
disintegrated?" Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
YaSi n– no. 36 – verse 78 – 79
Note 1: the most important element in the test Allah put all humans in, is that they should believe in the unseen. That is, you believe in what Allah tell you. However, you do not see it with your own eyes. For, If Allah revealed to humans all the unseen like paradise and hellfire and angels, most humans would believe in Allah in this case, but this belief at this time would be useless because they saw with their own eyes. It is not real belief. And this is exactly what will happen at the day of resurrection; All humans will see everything with their own eyes and they will believe in Allah and in paradise and hellfire, but this belief will not be accepted from them at this time because they did not believe in the unseen Allah had told them about in their life before death.
Note 2: Allah can easily make all humans believe in Him forcefully. For example, he could deprive all unbelievers from food or water or any vital blessing and grant these to the believers only. In this case, people will look around and will see that food, water and blessings are given only to the believers. So, all people will believe in Allah.
But this is not what Allah want. Allah want you to believe in him voluntarily without obligation. He want you to believe in the unseen because if you see it with your eyes, it is not belief at this time. It is something you see with your eyes. Allah do not want a belief which you may be forced to because you need food and water. No, He provide in this life for both believers and unbelievers. So that no one is forced to believe. Allah also want you to believe in the unseen voluntarily and undergo some adversaries and calamities in this life. And if you do this successfully and be patient, you will deserve His biggest reward in the day of resurrection "eternal paradise". This is, simply, the logic, of your creator if you can understand.

chunks.question: So, if prophet Muhammad- as you say -was sent to all mankind without distinction, why should he be from the Arabs specifically and why should the revelation be in Arabic? Why not from any other continent like Europe, America or Africa? Why not in any other language like English, Spanish, German, Chinese, Mandarin, Indian ……. etc.?
chunks.answer:
Note: 1 – If Allah chose any language other than Arabic and any nation other than the Arabs for his last revelation, the same questions would be posed by other nations and speakers of different languages: Why this nation? And why this language specifically? But Allah must have His wisdom and knowledge which
may not be clear for us in selecting such a nation and such a language for his last revelation.
Note2: If you refer to history and see how Islam started and spread and how were the Arabs at this time compared to other civilizations around them, you may understand some of Allah's wisdom in this choice. For example, the Arabs were tribal and primitive people whose instinct was still pure. They were more prepared to accept Allah's revelation and to transfer it to other nations. On the other hand, The Roman and the Persian empires around them were civilized empires with all the corruption and wickedness of large empires. So, they were less ready to accept the revelation of Allah.
Note 3: Compared to other nations and empires at this time, the Arabs were almost the only people who lived without a country, an organized army, an emperor, a king or any organized government. They were primitive tribes with the pure ethics and the strong zeal and prejudice of tribal people.
All the previous circumstances may explain some of Allah's wisdom for this choice. You will never understand Allah's wisdom in everything. However, you may discern some of His wisdom if you learn and think neutrally.
"And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

They did everything possible to spread Islam, the word of Allah, they sacrificed their time, their lives, their fortunes, their children and sacrificed everything dear to them to spread Islam. but later century after century the later generations abandoned their religion’s regulations bit by bit and adopted other ideologies and consequently became weaker and less effective. chunks.question: How can I make sure that this Qur'an was revealed from Allah, the creator and not from any sophisticated liars or professional crooks?
chunks.answer:
Note1: Prophet Muhammad was illiterate. That is, he couldn't read or write, and so were most of the people living around him. Literacy was very rare in the Arab tribes at this time. You can refer to history to make sure about this fact. Allah intended that his messenger be illiterate so that the revelation can be a miracle and a sign for the prophet's truthfulness and honesty.
Allah make this fact clear in the following verses:
And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise, the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt."

Allah, also, knew that some people would say maybe Muhammad brought this Qur'an from other people or from wizards or from people of scriptures before Islam. Those who knew the bible and the Torah, but Qur'an replied to them with this verse:
"And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language."

If you are still doubtful, Allah challenge all humanity in this verse:
"And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our Servant [Muhammad], then produce a surah the like thereof and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful. But if you do not - and you will never be able to - then fear the Fire, whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers."
Al Baqarah– No.2 – verse 23 – 24
You may tell me that this challenge doesn't apply to me because my mother language is not Arabic. My answer is: I ask you to try to listen to some Quranic verses. I know you will not understand a single word because you do not understand Arabic, but I am sure you will feel that this is not human language even if you do not understand the meanings because Qur'an is a miraculous revelation.
"And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic." Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allah at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. chunks.question: Which religion does Qura'n want me to follow? because there are many religions and sects. And every group assumes that they are the only one on the right track and they will be in Paradise and the others will be in Hellfire.? P.32
chunks.answer:
Actually, the religion is one because God is one. It is logical. It is a very common mistake to say that there are many religions. Allah told us clearly in His last revelation to humanity that the religion of all prophets was Islam. And it is the only religion that is accepted by
Allah. People have created many religions and many names for Gods along history, but it is all falsification and illusion. Islam is the only true religion from Allah the one and only creator.
The following verses depict this fact clearly:
"Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account. So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants."

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: So, what about other religions like Christianity and Judaism? Aren't these religions sent from Allah either?
chunks.answer:
Allah sent all his prophets: Noah, Saleh, Ibrahim, Jacob, Ismael, Moses, Jesus and Muhammad with only one religion and one message. The message all prophets came with was briefly:
"Believe in Allah, the one and only God who created you and believe in all his messengers, Books, angels, the Last Day, Paradise and Hellfire". Believe in Allah and obey His messengers.
Judaism, Christianity, Islam and all the other books and papers sent to messengers had only one message as explained previously. So, what is the difference?
The difference is only in religious legislation" . That is, the way people should pray or fast or pay money to the poor or how people should deal with each other. This religious legislation was different from one messenger to another to suit the time, the age and the kind of people, but the belief was always the same.
"Believe in Allah, your creator and believe in all his messengers, Books, angels, the Last Day, Paradise and Hellfire". Believe and obey.”
So, the question is: Are all these religions or names accepted by Allah now? The answer is definitely “No".
Allah accept only Islam as a religion. But, why? The answer, simply, is that the books sent to Noah, Abraham, Moses and Jesus were relevant to those prophets’ ages only. Every prophet of them was sent to his people at his time, but Prophet Muhammad was sent to all humanity until the last day of this world. Definitely and logically, Allah stipulated that Muslims should believe in Allah's messengers who came before Muhammad, but they should only follow the legislation of Islam because this is the legislation Allah wanted for our time.
The following verses explain these points:
"Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him. "And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 84 – 85

chunks.question: But the adherents of each religion or sect call the others unbelievers. And they sometimes kill each other. Every sect assumes that it is the only one on the right track. How do you explain this?

This has been the habit throughout history and will always be the habit. People disagreed about their prophets and invented strange sects out of the true religion. This happened almost with all the messengers we know from Moses to Muhammad.
This fact is illustrated clearly in the following Hadeeth and verses:
It was narrated from ‘Awf bin Malik that the Messenger of Allah(ﷺ) said:
“The Jews split into seventy-one sects, one of which will be in Paradise and seventy in Hell. The Christians split into seventy-two sects, seventy-one of which will be in Hell and one in Paradise. I swear by the One Whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad, my nation will split into seventy-three sects, one of which will be in Paradise and seventy- two in Hell.” It was said: “O Messenger of Allah, who are they?” He said: “They are the Muslims who follow what I and my companions do.”
Sunan Ibn Majah 3992 - Book 36, Hadith 67
"And We gave Jesus, the Son of Mary, clear proofs, and We supported him with the Pure Spirit. If Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, and some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends."
Al Baqarah– no. 2 – verse 253
"Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves.
Al 'Imran– no. 3 – verse 19

metadata.category: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: Christians have beliefs like the Trinity, Jesus is God, God is Jesus, or Jesus is the son of God. How does Islam see these beliefs?
chunks.answer:
Islam categorically rejects all beliefs that attribute divinity, sonship, or partnership to anyone besides Allah. According to Islam, Allah is absolutely One, unique, and incomparable. Nothing resembles Him in any way. He was not born from a woman, nor does He beget children. Allah does not need a wife, a companion, or a son. These human attributes imply weakness, need, and limitation, all of which are impossible for the Creator of everything.

How can Allah, the Creator of everything small and great, be compared to human beings with their inherent weaknesses, ignorance, and dependency? Attributing a child or partners to Allah is a grave falsehood and an immense injustice against His absolute perfection.

This fundamental truth is clearly and concisely stated in the Qur'an:

"Say, 'He is Allah, [who is] One. Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, nor is there to Him any equivalent.'"
Al-Ikhlas – no. 112 – verses 1–4

These verses define the Islamic concept of God with complete clarity, negating all forms of sonship, incarnation, or resemblance to creation.

The Qur'an further describes how severe and intolerable the claim of attributing a son to Allah is, to the extent that even the heavens and the earth almost collapse from its gravity:

"And they say, 'The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son.' You have done an atrocious thing. The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation. That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son. And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son. There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant. He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting. And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone."
Maryam – no. 19 – verses 88–95

Regarding the doctrine of the Trinity, Allah gives a clear and severe warning:

"They have certainly disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the third of three.' And there is no god except one God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict the disbelievers among them a painful punishment."
Al-Ma'idah – no. 5 – verse 73

Allah also explains that the claim of divine sonship is not new, but rather a repetition of false beliefs made by previous nations:

"The Jews say, 'Ezra is the son of Allah'; and the Christians say, 'The Messiah is the son of Allah.' That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved [before them]. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?"
At-Tawbah – no. 9 – verse 30

Finally, the Qur'an describes a decisive scene from the Day of Judgment, when Jesus himself will be questioned about these false claims:

"And [beware the Day] when Allah will say, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, did you say to the people, Take me and my mother as deities besides Allah?' He will say, 'Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself, and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen. I said not to them except what You commanded me – to worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I was among them; but when You took me up, You were the Observer over them, and You are, over all things, Witness.'"
Al-Ma'idah – no. 5 – verses 116–117

Thus, Islam honors Jesus as a noble prophet and messenger of Allah, but firmly rejects all claims of divinity, sonship, or partnership with Allah. Pure monotheism (Tawhid) is the core of Islamic belief, and any deviation from it is considered a serious misguidance.

chunks.question: Give me evidence that Jesus was a human like us and that he was only a messenger and he is not God or the son of God.
chunks.answer:
It is you who should give me evidence that he is God or the son of God. Jesus himself never claimed this. He was a messenger like all the messengers. He was a human who ate food, drank water and lived like a human. He had the body of a human. But Allah granted him some supernatural abilities and miracles to support his message. And Jesus was not the first prophet to be granted these miracles.
Other prophets before him were granted different miracles like
Saleh and Moses. Allah granted Jesus many supernatural abilities to support his message and to test his people.
This fact is clear in Qur'an:
( 110 ) [The Day] when Allah will say, "O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity; and [remember] when I taught you writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and when you designed from clay [what was] like the form of a bird with My permission, then you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission; and you healed the blind and the leper with My permission; and when you brought forth the dead with My permission; and when I restrained the Children of Israel from [killing] you when you came to them with clear proofs and those who disbelieved among them said, "This is not but obvious magic."
Al Ma"idah – No. 5 – Verse 110
Some people believed that Jesus may be the son of God because he was born without a father which was a great miracle. But Adam the father of all humanity was created without a father or a mother which is a more surprising miracle. So, why didn't they say about Adam that he is God or the son of God?
This fact is being told in Qur’an:
"Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created Him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.
The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters. Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our
women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate
earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars [among us]."
Al 'Imran– no. 3 – verse 59 – 61
Allah give strong warnings to the Christians in the following verses:
"O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
An Nisa– no. 4 – verse 171
"Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
An Nisa– no. 4 – verse 172

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: Christians believe that their religion is a universal one. And Jesus Christ was sent to all mankind. Do you have evidence against this in Islam?
chunks.answer:
Yes, I give you evidence against this from sound human logic, from Qur'an and from the Gospel respectively.
-	Evidence from Human Logic
-		How can a religion be universal to all mankind, if it has no detailed legislation for all the details in the human life?
Actually, Christianity is only pieces of spiritual advice. What should we do with someone who killed another one intentionally? What should we do with a thief? How should we punish a thug who takes people's property by force? How should people behave when they borrow or lend money?
What should be done with the fortune of someone when he passes away? How much should everyone in his family take from this fortune? These and many other basic questions have no answers in Christianity. In fact, Christians all over the world follow the human legislations of their own countries in all their
life details. These legislations are man-made of course. And they differ considerably from one country to another. And Christians, in some Arab countries, even, depend on the Islamic legislation concerning “inheritance". On the other hand, if you study Islam, you will find surprising detailed legislation for every minor detail in the life of a Muslim and a Muslim society.
Christianity- in fact – is not a complete religion. Jesus was sent to the Jews to guide and correct their deviation and uncontrolled love of material life. He did not come with legislation for everything in humans' life to be qualified as a religion for humanity. Jesus himself repeated many times "I did not come to change Moses' legislation." He also said; "I was sent to these Jews, sons of Jacob."
Evidence from Qur'an
-	In Qur'an Allah say about Jesus
-	"And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
-	As Saff – no. 61 – verse 6
However, Qur'an says about Muhammad
"And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know."
Saba" – no. 34 – verse 28
Whereas the first verse states that Jesus was only sent to the Israeli people and at the same time giving tidings of another prophet
following him, the second verse declares that Muhammad was sent to all mankind comprehensively.
Evidence from the Gospel:
during his earthly ministry, Jesus explicitly declared his mission to be focused only on Israel (Matt 15:24).
He claimed that his mission was only to the “lost sheep of the house of Israel” (Matt 15:24),
Other statements reinforce Jewish priority during the ministry of Jesus, including his decision to choose twelve disciples (corresponding, most likely, to the twelve tribes of Israel)
(Matt 15:31).

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: Jews also believe that they are the only beloved and preferred nation by Allah from all nations. And they are the children of God? How does Islam see this concept?
chunks.answer:
Evidence from Human Logic:
How can the great creator be biased with his creatures? How can He prefer a specific nation or people without fair justification? All humans are created by one God. So, it is logical and fair to deal with them equally. Even, humans disgust any unfair practices from other humans. So, how can we attribute the great creator with such unfair practices among His servants?
Jews have never asked people throughout history to follow their religion. They consider it a religion only for themselves or for the elite. And they consider themselves the unique people in this world. Also, they have strange racist beliefs that always claim that they are the chosen nation by Allah and they are the only nation whom Allah love and they are the only nation that will be saved from the Fire.
This is one big proof Judaism is a biased and incomplete religion. Allah discuss and answer their biased allegations logically in Qur’an.
Evidence from Qur'an:
( 18 ) But the Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of Allah and His beloved." Say, "Then why does He punish you for your sins?" Rather, you are human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination.
Al Ma"idah – no.5 – verse 18
Allah challenge the Jews in the following verses to wish for death if they are the allies of Allah as they claim:
( 6 ) Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."
( 7 ) But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
( 8 ) Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
Al Jumu'ah – no. 62 – verse 6 – 8
Again, Allah discuss their false allegations logically in these verses:
( 80 ) And they say, "Never will the Fire touch us, except for a few days." Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will never break His covenant. Or do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"
Al Baqarah – no.2 – verse 80
Explanation:
In the previous verses, Allah refute their false allegations that they are the chosen nation or that they are the only paradise dwellers and challenge them to prove their truthfulness by wishing death which they will never do.

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: I think every prophet had his own religion. Judaism was the religion of Moses. Christianity was the religion of Jesus and Islam was the religion of Muhammad? Am I right?
chunks.answer:
No, I told you before that there aren't different religions. Allah revealed only one religion to all his messengers, but this religion had different legislations to suit different ages and circumstances. So, it is right to say that Moses was given a legislation to his nation. But Jesus was not given new legislation. He was following the legislation of Moses. Jesus was given spiritual teachings to control and curb the excessive materialism of the Jews. Muhammad was given a legislation for the people from his time to the end of time. But Prophets Abraham, Isaac, Moses, Jesus and Muhammad had one religion. Only one religion but with different legislations to suit the different ages.
This is obvious in the following verses:
"And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous. When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted [in Islam] to the Lord of the worlds." And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims." Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" They said, "We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
Al Baqarah- No. 2 – verse 130 – 133

metadata.category: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets

chunks.question: And what was this message or belief that Allah sent all his prophets with?
chunks.answer:
The message -simply- is:
"Worship and obey your creator who created you and provide for you. Worship and obey Him and his messengers in this short life. And never associate anyone or anything to Allah. Allah is incomparable. Worship and obey only Him. And there is another eternal life after death where good doers will be granted paradise forever and wrong doers will be afflicted by hellfire forever"
This was the message of all prophets to all humans throughout the different ages of human history.
This message is clear enough in the following verses:
"O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous -[He] who made for you the earth a bed [spread out] and the sky a ceiling and sent down from the sky, rain and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not attribute to Allah equals while you know [that there is nothing similar to Him].
Al Baqarah– No.2 – verse 21, 22

chunks.type: Section B – Questions about religions: Islam, Christianity, Judaism, other religions, Prophet Muhammad and other prophets
chunks.question: If all the prophets and messengers were Muslims as you say and they had one belief and one message, so what were the main differences among those prophets?
chunks.answer:
I told you before. The difference among prophets was the religious legislation. That is, the way people should live, pray, fast, pay money to the poor and deal with each other…etc.? The legislation was slightly different according to every age and its requirements and according to the evils that were widespread among a specific nation.
However, some legislations were the same with different prophets. For example, all the prophets prohibited all kinds of wines and pork. Killing without reason, thuggery and theft were forbidden and disdained by all prophets. …. etc. Differences were slight not major.
Generally speaking, all prophets were instructed to forbid the evil practices and to permit the good, fair and useful deeds.

chunks.question: Well, if Judaism, Christianity and Islam were all one religion but with different legislations as you say, then prophet Muhammad, the last messenger to humanity must have been mentioned in the Torah and the Bible. And Allah must have ordered them to follow and obey Muhammad when his time comes. But I did not hear anything about Muhammad in the Torah or the Bible. How do you explain this?
chunks.answer:
Of course, he was mentioned in all these books. But everything was deleted and changed intentionally throughout the ages.
This fact is explicit in Qur'an:
"Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize Muhammad as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not believe."
Al An'am– no. 6 – verse 20
"And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].
Al Baqarah-no.2 – verse 101
Here Allah state that the Jews know the attributes of prophet Muhammad more than they know their own children, but they concealed the truth intentionally:
"Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know [it]."
Al Baqarah-no.2 – verse 146
Note1: The Jews in Medina at the time of prophet Muhammad knew from their books that a messenger will be sent in this time and in this place and they knew his characteristics very precisely from their Torah. And they were the people who spread this news among the tribes of Madinah. But they thought that this prophet would be from the Jews not from the Arabs. When the prophet came to be from the Arabs, they disbelieved in him only out of jealousy and arrogance. Refer to history to make sure of this incident.
These verses brief the story:
"And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which was with them - although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so, the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers."
Al Baqarah-no.2 – verse 89

chunks.question: But why did Allah let these people change and distort His revelation to humans? He could prevent them from doing this definitely? What is the logic behind this?
chunks.answer:
Life is meant to be only a test for humans as I told you previously. It is not the perfect or the eternal life. So, Allah allowed people to do sinful acts in this life Although Allah do not like these acts. But he gave them the chance, the time and the will because it is only a test. For example, people kill, steal, rob, lie and commit adultery. It is the same idea as distorting or changing the revelation. All of these are atrocious human sinful acts that people commit.
Do Allah like killing, stealing, robbing or committing adultery? Definitely no. but he allowed people to do these acts to test them. Similarly, he let these people to distort and change His revelation to prove to them their wicked and malignant nature and to test other people at the same time. Who is going to follow the distorted revelation? And Who is going to search for the righteous truth?
Anyway, it is Allah’s wisdom and destiny. We have no choice.
Allah threaten those who changed His revelation in return for some world benefits in these verses:
( 79 ) So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands, then say, "This is from Allah," in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.
Al Baqarah – no. 2 – verse 79

chunks.question: Give me simple and logical evidence that the prophets and their father Abraham were Muslims. And they were neither Christians nor Jews.
chunks.answer:
There is very clear chronological evidence that Abraham was not Christian nor a Jew. How can he be Christian or Jew when he and all his sons came before Jesus and Moses? All the prophets came before Jesus and Moses except prophet Muhammad. All the prophets including Noah, Abraham, Jacob, Houd, Saleh, Lout, Shuaib…etc. So, the question is obvious: if all these prophets were neither Christians nor Jews, what was their religion? Refer to Diagram no. 3 in this book: “Timeline of the prophets and its implications” p. 263 to make sure about this fact.
Qur'an stated this fact in the following verse:
"O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?"
Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 65

Of course, I was not there when they made this but Allah told us in
Qur’an about these incidents:

Al Baqarah- no.2 – verse 79
"And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], "You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it." But they threw it away behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. And wretched is that which they purchased.
Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 187

chunks.question: And what about other religions in some parts of the world that are followed by hundreds of millions of people like Hinduism (about 820 million followers) or Buddhism (about 320 million followers)? Do they have any origins? Are they mentioned in your book?
chunks.answer:
Well, I am not an expert in comparative religions. I am a normal Muslim as I told you. But you can test the validity and credibility of any of these religions in a simple way. Try to find answers- in these religions- to some of the basic questions I have answered you from an Islamic perspective. You can do this easily online and see how valid and credible are these beliefs. The basic questions in part one could be a preliminary criterion or a touchstone to test the validity and the credibility of these religions. Basic questions about God, His qualities, why He created us, how should we lead a good life, what awaits us after death and other basic questions can show the authenticity and the logic of any religion. Don’t be misguided by
the number of people who embrace one religion or another. The number of followers can never be a biased criterion because many people along the history of humanity are mindless and fanatic. They follow a specific group or belief blindly not logically. Can any religion on Earth give you logical, reasonable and comprehensive answers to some of the basic questions you are asking about now? Search on your own. I tried to give you the answers from Islam. You can compare and decide for yourself.

chunks.question: But the Muslims themselves (about 1.2 billion) are divided into many sects: sunnah, Shia'a, Alawiyeen …etc. and many other sects. Which sect should we follow if we want to be true Muslims?
chunks.answer:
The prophet said that the Jews were split into so many sects and so were the Christians and so will the Muslims. This is Allah's destiny that in every Heavenly legislation, you find corrupt people who deviate from the right path and misunderstand Allah's revelation. But there will be always one sect which will always be on the right track. This sect is the one that is guided by Qur’an and Prophet Muhammad's Sunnah. So, any people who are guided by Qur'an and authentic Sunnah will be on the right track.
Narrated AbuHurayrah:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The Jews were split up into seventy-one or seventy-two sects; and the Christians were split up into seventy-one or seventy-two sects; and my community will be split up into seventy- three sects.
Sunan Abi Dawud 4596 - Book 42, Hadith 1

chunks.question: But even the Sunnah Muslims have different "Mazahib" or "Jurisprudences' that reflect different ways of "worshipping: like "Abu Hanifa Jurisprudence" "Malik Jurisprudence", “Ahmad Ibn Hanbal Jurisprudence” and "Al Shafi' Jurisprudence. How do you explain these differences?
chunks.answer: Those "Mazahib" or different Jurisprudences you are talking about are not a disadvantage of Islam. On the contrary, they are an advantage because they made Islam a very flexible religion. They never disagreed about the basics of Islam like the main faith and the pillars of Islam. They only disagreed in marginal things like the way you raise your hand during praying or the way you do a specific thing. These minor disagreements are a result of different reasons. But in the end, they make Islam a very flexible jurisprudence which is viable to be applied everywhere and at any time provided that you do not change the basics which are the main faith and the pillars of Islam.

chunks.question: You frequently include in your answers some hadeeths from Prophet Muhammad. Are his hadeeths very important in Islam? Do Muslims have to obey the prophet in everything he says in his hadeeths? Is there evidence in Quran about this?
chunks.answer:
Prophet Muhammad's “hadeeths” or sayings are an integral part of Islam. You cannot understand many verses of Qur’an unless you read Prophet Muhammad’s “Hadeeths or sayings.
"Certainly, did Allah confer [great] favor upon the believers when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom, although they had been before in manifest error.
Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 164
"Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know."
Al Baqarah- no.2 – verse 151
Note the 2 underlined words in both verses: the book and wisdom
Most of Islamic scholars in Tafseer agreed that the words: the book and wisdom in these verses refer to Qura'n and Sunnah. Also , Islamic scholars agreed that sunnah should be followed as it is the second source of Islamic legislation after Qura'n. In fact, Sunnah is an explanation and clarification to many of the Qura'n verses. You can never apply details of prayers, fasting and all pillars of Islam unless you study Sunnah in detail. The prophet, even, warned us from some people in our age who are alleging that they will abide only by Qur'an and abandon Sunnah. In fact, these people are very wicked and cunning. They want neither Qur'an nor Sunnah. And they know very well that you will never be able to abide by Qur'an if you neglect Sunnah. Actually, Qur'an and Sunnah are twins. You have to study both side by side to understand Islam. It could be said that Sunnah is always a practical application of Islam and sometimes an explanation of Quranic verses.
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Beware! I have been given the Qur'an and something like it, yet the time is coming when a man replete on his couch will say: Keep to the Qur'an; what you find in it to be permissible treat as permissible, and what you find in it to be prohibited treat as prohibited. Beware! ……."
Sunan Abi Dawud 4604
English translation: Book 41, Hadith 4587
Allah confirm the necessity of obeying and respecting His messenger in many verses:
"But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission."
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 65
"O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result."
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 59
"Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
Al 'Imran– no. 3 – verse 31
"And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
At Taghabun– no. 64 – verse 12

chunks.question: I heard that the companions of prophet Muhammad disagreed about several things after his death. There were, even, some battles among them at the time of the Khalifa Ali Bin Abi Taleb. How do you explain that?
chunks.answer:
Generally speaking, disagreements always happen among humans. Disagreements among the companions happened not only after prophet Muhammad, but they also happened during his life – again- these disagreements were not on the basics or the pillars of Islam. They were on the marginal things. Moreover, they were not disagreements on the basic belief. Rather, they were political disagreements. Islam is not rigid. It is a flexible religion. In other words, it can accommodate different opinions and styles of living provided that you do not change the basics of the belief.
Yes, some of the companions of the Prophet disagreed and even had battles but every part thought they were on the right side.
Every party had their own understanding. And these disagreements were few. And some hypocrites ignited these battles. Companions of the prophet were very pious, honest and dedicated. Allah commended them in Qur’an and the prophet did in his Hadeeths. Anyway, it was part of the long test destined by Allah.

chunks.question: I heard that the first Muslims were very powerful, very good- mannered and very advanced during, approximately, the first three centuries of Islam, but it is very different now. So, if Islam was the right religion for all humanity, as you say, then why are many Muslim countries and Muslim individuals nowadays weak, underdeveloped and uncivilized? And there are a lot of conflicts and strives among them?

Note1: Muslims became the main power in the world after about 50 years from the outset of Islam because they adhered to Qur'an and Prophet Muhammad's teachings. When they started to abandon Islam teachings and ignore Qur'an and Sunna's regulations, they became weaker and more corrupt bit by bit until the present day.
Actually, Muslims’ lack of civilization and backwardness in spite of having the true religion from Allah is great evidence that Allah do not favor any nation or He has no bias for a specific nation. In other words, if any nation from the unbelievers worked hard in life and learnt and followed the reasons of power and wealth, Allah would give them power and livelihood as long as they work hard and honestly. On the contrary, if a nation of believers does not follow the reasons of power and wealth, they will be backward and uncivilized even if they have the true religion of Allah. Definitely, Allah is fair. He is unbiased even with unbelievers.
Muslim countries will never retain the powerful and prestigious status of their ancestors until they abide by the regulations of Islam very strongly, work hard in life and follow the reasons of power and wealth. This is one of Allah's laws in this life as it is explained in the following verses:
"And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment."
At Talaq-no.65 – verse – 8
"Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness]."
Ar Rum– no. 30 – verse 41
( 96 ) And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."
Al A'raf – No. 7 – verse 96

chunks.question: But I heard that this religion spread by wars and violence. And that Muslims invaded many countries where they spread their religion by force.
chunks.answer:
All Muslims' wars aimed at 3 targets:
1.	Intimidating some neighbor countries who were threatening Muslims and showing aggressive behavior.
2.	Spreading Islam among those who wanted it willingly but were unable to embrace it because of the unfair power of their emperors or kings. So, Muslims never forced anyone to accept Islam. Rather, they wanted to give everyone in this world the free will to choose for himself what he likes away from any unfair power exercised on him.
So, no forcing or compulsory practices were exercised to accept Islam. Conversely, they were donating everyone the free will to choose his religion.
In all Muslim wars, prophet Muhammad was instructing them to offer 3 choices to their opponents: to accept Islam, or to pay tribute "jizya” or to have war with them.
But why must they pay tribute if they will not accept Islam? Is this an indirect way to force them to accept Islam? Of course, not for two reasons:
1.	Even if they accept Islam, they will pay "zakat" for poor people. "the 3rd pillar of Islam" that rich people should pay a small amount of their money to the poor. So, in both cases, they will pay.
2.	"jizia" is being paid for the purpose of defending this country. Or that Muslims wanted to make sure by this Jizya that this country will be allegiant to the Muslims in the future and they will not start a war against them. In the meantime, Muslims will use this money to defend this nation against any enemies. And any way, it was the verdict of Allah who know what is best for his servants.
Answer from Qur’an
"And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allah and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?"
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 75
In the previous verse Allah explain for us that fighting against the unbeliever oppressor emperors and kings is very important because it is the only way helpless and weak people can get rid of these oppressors and have the freedom to worship Allah
"They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is great [sin], but averting [people] from the way of Allah and disbelief in Him and [preventing access to] al-Masjid al-Haram and the expulsion of its people therefrom are greater [evil] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is greater than killing." And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they are able….."
Al Baqarah– no. 2 – verse 217
"Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not."
Al Baqarah– no. 2 – verse 216 Answer from “Sunnah”
Sulaiman bin Buraidah reported on the authority of his father. When the Apostle of Allaah(ﷺ) appointed a Commander over an Army or a detachment, he instructed him to fear Allah himself and consider the welfare of the Muslims who were with him. He then said “When you meet the polytheists who are your enemy, summon them one of three things and accept whichever of them they are willing to agree to, and refrain from them. Summon them to Islam and if they agree, accept it from them and refrain from them. Then summon them to
leave their territory and transfer to the abode of the Emigrants and tell them that if they do so, they will have the same rights and responsibilities as the Emigrants, but if they refuse and choose their own abode, tell them that they will be like the desert Arabs who are Muslims subject to Allah’s jurisdiction which applies to the believers, but will have no spoil or booty unless they strive with the Muslims. If they refuse demand jizyah (poll tax) from them, if they agree accept it from them and refrain from them. But if they refuse, seek Allah’s help and fight with them. When you invade the fortress and they (its people) offer to capitulate and have the matter referred to Allah’s jurisdiction, do not grant this, for you do not know whether or not you will hit on Allah’s jurisdiction regarding them. But let them capitulate and have the matter refereed to your jurisdiction and make a decision about them later on as you wish.
Sahih (Al-Albani)	Sunan Abi Dawud 2612 Book 15, Hadith 136 :
Book 14, Hadith 2606 :

chunks.question: Was fighting obligatory for Muslims? They didn’t have any other peaceful solutions?
chunks.answer:
you will always find that Muslims were not the initial aggressors. Firstly, they were attacked. After that, they went to war to defend themselves.
(Refer to history to confirm the authenticity of this information)
Islam started peacefully. There was no fighting at the beginning. Muslims wanted to spread their true religion peacefully among people. They didn't force people to be Muslims. But sovereign nations and empires saw in Islam a big threat to their tyranny and sovereignty over their nations. Islamic fair legislations were generally against the interests of rich, powerful and leading people who were greedy for money and power at the expense of other poor people. So, these sovereign nations started aggression against Islam. When the new religion was in danger, Allah ordered his Muslim servants to defend their religion by fighting in order to give the fair chance to
all people in all nations to see and understand Islam. And in the end, it is up to their discretion to embrace Islam or not.
For example, Al-Harith Ibn Umair Al-Azdy, the messenger of Prophet Muhammad to the Romans, was killed by Shurahbeel ibn ‘Amr Al- Ghassaani, the king of Busraa in Ash-Shaam. The prophet's messenger was sent only to call them to Islam peacefully. But he was killed brutally, contrary to the usual generous and protective behavior towards messengers at that time.
Before this incident, relations between the Muslims and the Romans were strained, for the Romans together with their Arab allies used to aggravate and provoke the Muslims by any means. This was particularly apparent in their frequent attempts to attack the Muslim merchandise coming from Ash-Shaam (Greater Syria) and the plundering of the caravans threading their roads, not to speak of the stress and grief that they subjected to every Muslim they could seize.
Consequently, the Prophet, ( MPBUH ), called the Muslims to go out to fight the Romans so that he would discipline them and put an end to their barbarian conduct. Quickly, three thousand warriors assembled and it was the battle of Mu'tah.
So, Muslims were ordered to defend their religion and defend other people's freedom to accept or refuse Islam. Muslims were not fighting for power or money. They were only trying to give other poor people in sovereign nations the freedom to select the religion they wanted.
These ideas are explained in the following verses:
( 256 ) There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
Al Baqarah – no.2 – verse 256
( 39 ) Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.
( 40 ) [They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allah." And were it not that Allah checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
Al Hajj – no. 22 – verse 39 – 40

chunks.question: What about slavery? I heard that Muslims were taking captives in war as slaves. Is this true?
chunks.answer:
Yes, slavery did exist in the Muslim world, but understanding Islam’s position on slavery requires historical context and a fair comparison with how slavery existed before and outside Islam.

Slavery was savagely rampant in all nations before the advent of Islam and was widespread among people of all religions. There were many sources of slavery, including warfare, debt (where a debtor who could not repay became a slave), kidnapping, raids, poverty, and need. In short, there were numerous ways to enslave people, while the means of freeing slaves were almost nonexistent.

When Islam came, it completely changed this reality. Islam restricted and regulated slavery, blocked most of its sources, and opened many doors for manumission. While slavery had many entry points before Islam, Islam limited it to only one source: enslavement through war, and only in the case of unbelieving prisoners of war, along with their women and children.

At the same time, Islam introduced numerous ways to free slaves and strongly encouraged manumission as an act of worship and expiation for sins. Thus, Islam was generally against slavery as a system, but dealt with an already existing global institution in a gradual, realistic, and humane way.

In fact, Muslims were the most merciful among all nations in dealing with war captives. While captives in other civilizations were often killed, tortured, or imprisoned for years under inhumane conditions, Islam commanded that captives be treated with mercy, kindness, and dignity.

Yes, Muslims did take unbelieving war captives as slaves by divine legislation. However, they were commanded to treat them with compassion and justice. This close interaction allowed captives to observe Islam directly, often leading them to accept it willingly. At the same time, Islam encouraged their freedom through many means.

This ruling also carried a divine wisdom and punishment. It is as though Allah was saying: because these people arrogantly refused to submit to their Creator, the Most Merciful, they would experience servitude to other human beings. Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise in His judgments, and humans can only attempt to understand part of His wisdom.

Below is a brief summary of some of the Islamic principles governing the treatment of slaves, as mentioned in authentic hadiths:

1. Equality in food and clothing
The slaves’ food and clothing should be the same as that of their masters.

It was narrated that Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
"They are your brothers whom Allah has put under your authority. So if Allah has put a person’s brother under his authority, let him feed him from what he eats and clothe him from what he wears. Do not overburden him with work, and if you do overburden him, then help him."
Al-Bukhari (6050)

2. Preserving their dignity
Islam strictly forbade humiliating or falsely accusing slaves.

It was narrated that Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
"Whoever accuses his slave of something he did not do will be flogged on the Day of Resurrection unless he is as he said."
Al-Bukhari (6858)

Ibn ‘Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) freed a slave and said:
"I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: Whoever slaps his slave or beats him, his expiation is to manumit him."
Muslim (1657)

3. Fairness and kindness in treatment
Many of the companions applied these teachings practically.

‘Uthman ibn ‘Affan once tweaked the ear of a slave and later insisted that the slave retaliate against him, saying he feared punishment on the Day of Resurrection.

When ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn ‘Awf walked among his slaves, no one could distinguish him from them, as he dressed and walked just like them.

‘Umar ibn al-Khattab once saw slaves standing while their master ate alone. He rebuked him and ordered the slaves to eat with him.

Salman al-Farisi, while serving as a governor, was seen kneading dough himself. When asked why, he replied that he had sent his servant on an errand and did not want to burden him with two tasks.

4. Slaves may surpass free people in merit
Islam recognizes merit and competence regardless of social status. A slave may excel over a free person in religious or worldly matters. It is even valid for a slave to lead the prayer. ‘A’ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) had a slave who used to lead her in prayer. Muslims were commanded to obey leaders even if a slave was appointed over them.

5. The right to buy one’s freedom (Mukaatabah)
Islam allowed and encouraged slaves to purchase their freedom through a contract with their masters if goodness was found in them.

Allah says in the Qur'an:
"And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess – then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you."
An-Nur – no. 24 – verse 33

This is how Islam established justice, mercy, and human dignity in a world where slavery was once brutal and unchecked.

The French historian Gustave Le Bon said in his book *Hadaarat al-‘Arab (Arab Civilization)*:
"What I sincerely believe is that slavery among the Muslims is better than slavery among any other people, and that the situation of slaves in the East is better than that of servants in Europe. Slaves in the East are part of the family. Slaves who wanted to be free could attain freedom by expressing their wish, but despite that, they did not resort to exercising this right."
