chunks.question: But in our age, everyone can see that terrorism and slaying have become closely related to Islam everywhere, to the extent that many nations have come to associate Islam with terrorism. How does Islam respond to this accusation?
chunks.answer:
Islam categorically rejects terrorism, murder, and unlawful killing in all its forms. Killing is one of the most forbidden and gravely sinful acts in Islam, whether the victim is a Muslim or a non-Muslim. The sanctity of human life is a fundamental principle in Islamic law.

Even during times of war, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) laid down strict moral rules that prohibited the killing of non-combatants. He commanded his companions not to kill old people, children, babies, or women. Islamic mercy extended even to animals and insects.

The first Muslim caliph, Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him), advised the army commander Abu ‘Ubaydah when sending him to war, saying: "Do not kill women, children, or the elderly. Do not slaughter a camel or a cow except for food. Do not burn palm trees or drown bees." These instructions were given in wartime. If this was Islamic conduct during war, then mercy and justice in times of peace are even more emphasized.

All acts of killing, terrorism, and bloodshed are completely alien to Islam. Those who commit such crimes while claiming to be Muslims are either ignorant of Islam, deliberately distorting it, or acting as mercenaries serving political and financial agendas. Some perpetrators may be Muslims, but they grossly misunderstand Islamic teachings. Others are paid agents whose goal is to tarnish the image of Islam and divert people from believing in Allah and embracing the true religion.

It is no secret that many individuals, organizations, and media institutions actively work to slander Islam for reasons related to power, control, political influence, economic interests, or blind bias toward other beliefs. The spread of Islam as a complete way of life conflicts with the interests of many global systems and industries.

Allah says in the Qur'an:

"And never will the Jews or the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, 'Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the only guidance.' If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah no protector or helper."
Al-Baqarah – no. 2 – verse 120

Therefore, anyone who truly seeks to understand Islam must avoid judging it through media propaganda, sensational news, or the actions of criminals. Islam should be understood through its primary sources: the Qur'an with its sound explanation by Sunni scholars, and the authentic Sunnah with its correct interpretation. Islam must not be judged by mercenaries, blood traffickers, or ignorant and hypocritical Muslims who prioritize personal interests over their religion.

The Qur'an and the Sunnah repeatedly describe unlawful killing as a major and destructive sin.

Allah says:

"Say, 'Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you: that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities – what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right.'"
Al-An‘am – no. 6 – verse 151

Allah also says:

"Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption done in the land – it is as if he had slain all mankind. And whoever saves one – it is as if he had saved all mankind."
Al-Ma'idah – no. 5 – verse 32

The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said:

"Whoever kills a Mu‘ahid (a non-Muslim under Muslim protection) shall not smell the fragrance of Paradise, though its fragrance can be smelled from a distance of forty years."
Sahih al-Bukhari – Book 87, Hadith 52

He (ﷺ) also said:

"The first matter concerning which people will be judged on the Day of Resurrection will be the matter of blood."
Al-Bukhari and Muslim

The Prophet (ﷺ) further warned:

"Avoid the seven destructive sins." He mentioned among them: "killing a soul which Allah has forbidden except by right."
Al-Bukhari and Muslim

In a powerful narration, Ibn ‘Abbas reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

"The slain person will bring his killer on the Day of Resurrection, holding his forelock and head, with blood flowing from his veins, saying: 'O Lord, he killed me,' until they reach the Throne."

Ibn ‘Abbas then recited Allah’s saying:

"And whoever kills a believer intentionally, his recompense is Hell."

This verse, he said, was never abrogated and carries a severe and lasting warning.

Thus, Islam stands firmly against terrorism, murder, and bloodshed. Any attempt to associate Islam with terrorism is either based on ignorance or deliberate distortion. Islam is a religion of justice, mercy, and the sanctity of human life.

chunks.question: Do you mean that some of the fundamental Islamic organizations are fake Muslims and mercenaries?
chunks.answer:
Some of them were mercenaries and pretending Muslims. They were paid generously by unknown organizations to distort Islam and show it as a bloody and savage religion in the international media. And some of them were true believers but they were misguided to believe that killing innocent people was a kind of “Jihad”.
Of course, it is impossible to say who were “paid mercenaries” and who were “true Muslims but misguided”? because such information is usually unavailable to ordinary people. Moreover, most Islamic groups that took to fighting and killing innocents were a combination of both the mercenaries and the misguided Muslims.
Allah know all the hidden secrets. And He will reveal to us everything on the Day of Judgment. And everyone will be evaluated fairly.

chunks.question: I heard that religious verdicts in Islam are severe. For example, a thief’s hand should be cut off. A killer must be killed. A thug must be punished by cutting off one hand and one leg from the opposite side. Aren’t these Islamic verdicts severe and against human rights in our modern world?
chunks.answer:
Human rights are a great and noble issue, but they should be given to innocent and normal people who deserve them, not to thieves and criminals. If human rights are given blindly to thieves and criminals, crimes will increase uncontrollably which is happening nowadays in many countries.
On the contrary, these verdicts are compatible with human rights in our age because when people recognize that the punishment will be very severe. They will think a lot before committing any crime. Ultimately, this will save innocent people from crimes and will save people with criminal inclinations from being criminals or from losing parts of their bodies.
This is human nature; people with criminal inclinations tend to commit crimes when they feel that they may get away unpunished or that the punishment may be light.
How do modern countries treat thieves and criminals? They are imprisoned for different periods according to each country's laws. What happens is that many prisoners become more cruel and professional criminals after they finish their sentences. In addition, they cost the country a lot of money for accommodation, food, medical care, guarding…. etc.
Islam's verdicts are practical, realistic and decisive. They eradicate the crimes before they start because people feel too much scared from committing a crime because of the severe punishment. As a result, the percentage of crimes decline dramatically. And the society becomes a safe place. Secondly, these verdicts cost the country much less than imprisoning people.
Study what happens in the world and you will find that countries which equip their prisons with means of entertainment and all life requirements are the same countries that have a high percentage
of crimes. Why should prisoners abandon their crimes when the punishment is so light and the prison is comfortable? Again, it is human nature.
These verdicts were preordained by Allah, the all-knowing and the most merciful. He is the creator of people. And He is the one who know what is good for them.
Finally, in some crimes it is very hard to prove the crime on the perpetrator and carry out the verdict because Allah stipulate harsh conditions for proving the crime. So, it is not cruel or very harsh as you think.

chunks.question: Can you give me an example of a crime that is hard to prove on the perpetrator in Islam?
chunks.answer:
Yes, the crime of adultery or fornication is very hard to prove on a woman because you have to bring four witnesses who saw the crime with their own eyes which is practically impossible. And if anyone accuses a woman of adultery whereas he has no witnesses, he should be punished with 80 lashes. This is to prevent people from making false accusations. Read the following verse to see the verdict.
( 4 ) And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,
An Nur – no. 24 – verse 4

chunks.question: And who is entitled to carry out these verdicts in case? Can anyone carry out the verdict on any guilty person? Is there a system for this?
chunks.answer:
Only the ruler or the king or the president or the judge or whoever represents him in a given country is entitled to carry out these verdicts. Not everyone can do this. Or it will be chaotic. Islam is a
very systematic religion. So, the people in charge only can carry out these verdicts. Actually, these Islamic verdicts have got many details and conditions to be effective. If you read about these details and conditions, you will understand how Islam is a very practical, wise, systematic and merciful legislation at the same time.

chunks.question: But are these verdicts applied in Islamic countries right now?

Unfortunately, most Islamic countries do not carry out these verdicts right now. They replaced the Islamic legislation with the human one a long time ago. Actually, this is a sign that Prophet Muhammad had told us it would happen near the end of time.
Read the following Hadeeths:
It is narrated on the authority of Abu Huraira that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
Islam initiated as something strange, and it would revert to its (old position) of being strange. so good tidings for the stranger.
Sahih Muslim 145 - Book 1, Hadith 279
It was narrated from ‘Abdullah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Islam began as something strange and will go back to being strange, so glad tidings to the strangers.” It was said: “Who are the strangers?’ He said: “Strangers who have left their families and tribes.” Sunan Ibn Majah 3988 - Book 36, Hadith 63

chunks.question: Some people say that in Islam, you have to respect and obey the companions of prophet Muhammad. Is this really part of Islam as they say?
chunks.answer:
Definitely, companions of the prophet should be respected and given due reverence of course as they are the best and the most righteous generation as Prophet Muhammad said.
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "I have been sent (as an Apostle) in the best of all the generations of Adam's offspring since their Creation."
Sahih al-Bukhari 355 - Book 61, Hadith 66
Moreover, they are the people whom Allah commended in Qur'an in many verses. Also, Allah expressed in other verses that He forgave them and granted them the highest levels as they obeyed Allah and His messenger and fought for the cause of Islam honestly.
But still, they are human, not infallible. So, some small mistakes are expected. So, if one of the companions of the prophet disagreed in a specific verdict with most of the companions, we should follow the opinion of the majority of course to be in the safe side.

chunks.question: So, should we follow the unanimous opinion of scholars in Islam even if a prominent scholar disagreed with them?
chunks.answer:
Yes, the unanimous opinion or the opinion of the majority is safer for ordinary Muslims like us. It is very improbable that the majority of scholars will agree on something wrong. But it sometimes happens that one of the companions of the prophet or a prominent scholar has a weird ruling or a strange opinion which is different from the majority. So, yes, we should follow the unanimous opinion.
Companions of the prophet were very noble and righteous. However, they were humans. So, slight mistakes could happen. But, when they disagreed, it was not because of their lack of loyalty or faithfulness. Rather, it was because they disagreed in understanding some of prophet Muhammad's sayings. Or sometimes some of them did not hear the saying of the prophet.
In short, their disagreements were not about the basics of Islam.
Rather, they were about the small sections and branches. Also, their disagreements were limited and unintentional.

chunks.question: And what about women in Islam? I heard that Islam permits polygamy. That is, a man can marry up to 4 women at the same time. Isn't this a humiliation for women?
chunks.answer:
Islam allowed a man to marry up to 4 women. This is true. But this is an honor to women not humiliation for the following reasons:
Polygamy has got some benefits for nations. Some of these benefits are obvious. Others may not be clear for everyone because our minds and knowledge as humans are limited.
1.	Making polygamy permissible honors women as Allah wanted a woman to be always sponsored by a man who is responsible for her, spends on her needs and protects her. Allah do not want a woman to be liable to working conditions and humiliation in society. He wanted her to be kept at home as a jewel and the man works hard and provides for her. And if a woman needs to work, she may be liable to problems and humiliation. Or she may resort to illegal jobs to provide for herself.
2.	It is well-known that in many periods of history and nearly in all nations you can find the number of potential wives more than that of potential husbands. This is mainly because of major wars and civil wars which are usually an important reason behind the death of many young men. In addition, many men in every society are unwilling to get married for one reason or another. So, if you put all these factors into consideration, it will be unbalanced if we say that every man should take only one woman because in this case, you will find many women without a husband, especially, the divorced, the widowed and those who are not very attractive to men. Many women without a husband to protect them can be the reason for a lot of corruption in society.
3.	When Allah permitted polygamy for a man, He obliged him with many stipulations and responsibilities in order for this polygamy to be permissible. Firstly, he should be fair among his wives in overnight staying, expenses, intercourse and housing. It is also well-known that a man who has more than one wife always has a lot of responsibilities and he needs more expenses. So, in real life, especially in our age, you find that most men are satisfied with one wife only.
4.	If you have a close look at so many countries around the world right now, you will find the widespread of adultery and illegal sexual relations, infidelity between couples, sharp increase in spinsterhood. Even worse, sexual abnormalities have spread to an unprecedented rate. These abnormalities have got two forms: men together or women together. It even went farther to the extent of making sexual relations with animals in many countries. In spite of all this pornography which is legally acceptable in many countries, the laws forbid polygamy. And in many countries in the world now you can have a girl-friend to have sex with her without any troubles or you can be homosexual and have a relation with a man like you. But if you want a second wife as Allah permit, it is forbidden by law.
As a result of these crooked and wicked laws, you can find hundreds of thousands of children who are of anonymous decent. That is, their real fathers are not known. Also, you can find some societies who are on the verge of distinction as a result of low marriage rates. Actually, this leads to the disintegration of society as the family is the first cornerstone of any society. Without families, we would be just a number of scavengers killing each other. And this is only a sample of the dangerous diseases which afflicted humanity as a result of not abiding by Allah's religious law.
5.	We have to believe first that Allah the creator who made this verdict is all-knowing. He know exactly what makes us better. Also, we have to accept that there is righteousness and wisdom in this verdict even if we do not understand some of Allah's wisdom in this verdict.
Listen to this verse in Qur'an about polygamy:
"And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice]."
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 3

chunks.question: But Islam also instructs a woman to stay in her house and to cover all her body. In addition, it gives a woman half of the inheritance it gives to a man. Is this fair?
chunks.answer:
There isn't any religion or human law that honored women and gave them rights as Islam did. And here are some facts about how Islam honored the woman from her childhood to her old age:
1.	when Allah instructed a woman to cover her body and stay at home except for necessity, he made this to protect her because she is a precious thing. Allah wanted her to be a queen in her house and her husband provides for her. He didn't want her to be humiliated by an employer or to be abused by wicked people or to be sexually harassed by villains. He didn't want her to be a low-priced item available everywhere for whoever can pay as she is now. Haven't you noticed that when international companies advertise their goods, there must be beautiful girls with tight clothes beside their goods?
Isn't this a severe humiliation for her? To be abused as a beautiful body?
2.	It is not true that a woman always inherits half of what a man inherits. This happens only when both of them are in the same level. For example, if a man died and left 2 boys and 3 girls. In this case, a woman inherits half of a man. This verdict must have a divine wisdom whether we understand it or not. One human explanation is that men need more money because they should set up a new house and provide for a wife and children. On the contrary, a woman is not required to do this, when a man comes to marry her, he is responsible to provide for her and her children.
3.	There are many examples in jurisprudence when women inherit more than men. For instance, if a man dies and leaves 2 daughters but no sons or wife, the two daughters deserve two thirds of his property. However, his father deserves only one sixth of his property. There are many similar examples if you study the Islamic jurisprudence about inheritance
4.	Allah made the act of bringing up a girl and taking care of her a reason for entering paradise and escaping hellfire.
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Whoever supports two girls till they attain maturity, he and I will come on the Day of Resurrection like this". Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) joined his fingers illustrating this.
Sahih Muslim: Arabic/English book reference : Book 1, Hadith 267
5.	Then when she gets married, Allah stated for her a big number of rights and honors that her husband should take care of. There is no room to mention all of them now, but here are few examples:
( 2 ) And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.
( 3 ) And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].
( 4 ) And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.
Al- Nisa'a – no. 4 – verses 2,3,4
( 34 ) Men are in charge of women by [right of] what Allah has given one over the other and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth. So righteous women are devoutly obedient, guarding in [the husband's] absence what Allah would have them guard. But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance - [first] advise them; [then if they persist], forsake them in bed; and [finally], strike them. But if they obey you [once more], seek no means against them. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted and Grand.
( 35 ) And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allah will cause it between them. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].
Al- Nisa'a – no. 4 – verses 34,35
6.	Allah canceled all the habits that oppressed women and deprived them of their rights before Islam. Even when a man hates his wife, Allah teaches him in Qur'an what to do:
"O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good."
Al- Nisa'a – no. 4 – verse 19
7 . Prophet Muhammad described the best people as those who deal with their wives in the best way.
the Prophet said: "The best of you is the one who is best to his wife, and I am the best of you to my wives."
Sunan Ibn Majah 1977
In-book reference: Book 9, Hadith 133
English translation: Vol. 3, Book 9, Hadith 1977 Grade: Hasan
8.	Prophet Muhammad in some of his travels was very careful about women who were carried by the camels that he instructed the boy who was guiding the camels to guide them slowly
The Prophet (ﷺ) came to some of his wives among whom there was Um Sulaim, and said, "May Allah be merciful to you, O Anjasha! Drive the camels slowly, as they are carrying glass vessels!" Abu Qalaba said, "The Prophet (ﷺ) said a sentence (i.e. the above metaphor) which, had anyone of you said it, you would have admonished him for it".
Sahih al-Bukhari 6149 : Book 78, Hadith 175 -
9.	And when she becomes a mother, Allah made her rights over her children the highest and the most important
A man came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Who is more entitled to be treated with the best companionship by me?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Your mother." The man said. "Who is next?" The Prophet said, "Your mother." The man further said, "Who is next?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Your mother." The man asked for the fourth time, "Who is next?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Your father. "
: Sahih al-Bukhari 5971 : Book 78, Hadith 2

chunks.question: I also heard that prophet Muhammad married many women. Some people accuse him of being lustful and womanizer? What do you think?
chunks.answer:
Let me explain to you:
-	Prophet Muhammd has lived most of his young age from 25 to 50 with one woman only who was 15 years older than him "Khadija Bint Khowaild". And he was very young, and she has married before him. So, she was not virgin, but he kept faithful to her until her death.
-	He then married another woman "Sawda Bint Zama'a". She was not virgin either. Also, she was almost five years older than the prophet (MPBUH). She was nearly 55 whereas he was fifty. and she remained his only wife for another 3 years. She was not that attractive or a highborn woman or even a rich one.
The prophet married her to soothe her as most of her family were still unbelievers and she had no one to take care of.
-	Then, he started polygamy with a divine order when he saw "Aisha" in his dream. The angel showed her to him wrapped in a cloth and told him: “This is your wife”. The dream was repeated and the prophet recognized that this was a divine order. "Aisha" was his first "virgin wife" and he was 53 at the time.
-	Then marriages came in a row. Most of them were from previously married women or widows and was for different reasons that supported the new religion or to make a new legislation.
-	For example, his marriage to " Zainab bint Gahsh". This marriage was a heavenly order from Allah to make a new legislation for Muslims which cancels the habit of "adoption". Adoption meant that some people were taking some young boys as their real sons and giving them their names. Allah prohibited this in Islam. Prophet Muhammad himself adopted one boy whose name was "Zaid Ibn Haritha" before forbidding this by Allah. Zaid got married to "Zainab Bint Gahsh" and then they were divorced. Allah ordered his prophet to marry Zainab so that all Muslims understand that Zaid was no more the son of Prophet Muhammad and the prophet can marry Zaid's divorcee without any embarrassment. This happened at a time when Arab Muslims did not allow anyone to marry the divorcee of his adopted son. So, Allah made this marriage to eradicate the habit of adoption in the Muslim society. Allah narrated this incident in Qur'an:
"And [remember, O Muhammad], when you said to the one on whom Allah bestowed favor and you bestowed favor, "Keep your wife and fear Allah," while you concealed within yourself that which Allah is to disclose. And you feared the people, while Allah has more right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there not be upon the believers any discomfort concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they no longer have need of them. And ever is the command of Allah accomplished.
Al Ahzab – no. 33 – verse 37
-	Another example is when he married "Safiyya Bint Huyay Ibn Akhtab" because she was the daughter of a tribe's leader who were defeated in war and she was taken as captive.
Someone from the companions told the prophet that "She is
only suitable for you messenger of Allah" when one of the Muslims wanted her for himself. He wanted to give her due respect as the daughter of a leader and at the same time urge her tribe to embrace Islam.
-	Other marriages were for the sake of tightening the relation between him and some of his close companions and pleasing them as in the case of "Hafsa" the daughter of Omar Ibn El- Khattab.
-	Also, there are clear benefits in the prophet's several marriages in that these wives were an important tool to transfer the details of fiqh and Islamic legislation to other Muslim women. If it was one wife, she would not be able to discern and transfer all the prophetic and heavenly knowledge that need to be spread among the Muslim nation especially women.
-	Prophet Muhammad's stipend that was allocated for his wives’ expenses was very little to the extent that his wives once gathered and asked him to increase their stipends. At this time, the prophet kept himself away from them for one month and waited for divine inspiration. Then, Allah gave them the choice in Qur'an: either to be patient and accept a very little stipend with the prophet in return for unimaginable rewards from Allah in the last Day or to be divorced and be given their dowry peacefully. All his wives later chose to remain with the prophet and be patient. Actually, they chose "paradise". Allah narrated this incident in Qur'an when He gave the prophets' wives the option to choose for themselves.
"O Prophet, say to your wives, "If you should desire the worldly life and its adornment, then come, I will provide for you and give you a gracious release. But if you should desire Allah and His Messenger and the home of the Hereafter - then indeed, Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward."
Al Ahzab– no.33 – verse 28 ,29
-	. Definitely, the prophet could have been very rich and give his wives a large pocket money if he wanted as Allah made for him one fifth of the war spoils. But he gave everything to the poor and kept very little for himself. Allah wanted the prophet and his wives to be an example for every Muslim in the simple and humble way of living.
Once his wife "Aisha said Narrated `Aisha:
that she said to `Urawa, "O, the son of my sister! We used to see three crescents in two months, and no fire used to be made in the houses of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (i.e. nothing used to be cooked)." `Urwa said, "What used to sustain you?" `Aisha said, "The two black things i.e., dates and water, except that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had neighbors from the Ansar who had some she-camels, and they used to give the Prophet (ﷺ) some milk from their house, and he used to make us drink it."
Sahih al-Bukhari 6459 - Book 81, Hadith 48
-	Can you imagine a family living for two months or three in a row without cooking one meal in their house? It was only dates and water. So, could any lustful person who liked this life and its pleasures live like this?
-	If the prophet was lustful as some unbelievers accuse him, he would have married virgins and in young age to enjoy himself. Also, he would have spent a lot on his wives to enjoy everything in this life, but he was a prophet. And he was very ascetic in worldly pleasures.

chunks.question: And what about Islam's stance on money? I heard that Islam prohibits interest and consequently prohibits most of the modern banking transactions? Is this true? How can we get along with the current world financial system if we are Muslims?
chunks.answer:
Islam prohibited interest because it is the root of much evil in this world. Most of the bankers’ business is merely as “brokerage of interest”. They take money from depositors with a low interest, lend it to businessmen with a high interest. Then, the bankers take the difference as their profit. This is simply the main business of banks. As a direct result of this, the paper money increases dramatically without real production. And people are tempted to put their money in banks to take easy profit instead of making projects which create jobs and develop the economy. This incurs many disasters like inflation, unemployment, high prices…. etc.
Have a look at the economy of countries around you. You will find that there is a clear relation between high interest rates and inflation, high prices, unemployment and recession. On the other hand, you will find an obvious correlation between low-rate interests and economic boom, high rate of employment and stable prices.
This is a clear proof that interest is evil. It is against sound economies and healthy societies.
To be a true Muslim, you should avoid all banking transactions that include interest rates as usury is one of the terrible sins in Islam. Refer to economic news during the last 5 years to make sure that some of the developed countries with advanced technologies and a very strong economy had decided to decrease the rate of interest until it reached zero. Further, they made it minus. That is, if you deposit money in the bank, you will have to pay money for the bank to keep your money in it instead of taking profit.
What do you think will be the result of this? Definitely, people will refrain from depositing their money in banks. Instead, they will try to make investments. These investments will create jobs, increase sales and eventually develop the economy. Allah prohibited interest because it devastates the economies, spreads corruption, increases
prices and encourages people to stay at home, wait for easy profits and be jobless.
The following verses warn people against interest and usury:
( 275 ) Those who consume interest cannot stand [on the Day of Resurrection] except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, "Trade is [just] like interest." But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden interest. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair rests with Allah. But whoever returns to [dealing in interest or usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
Al-Baqara – no. 2 – verse 275
( 278 ) O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.
( 279 ) And if you do not, then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.
Al-Baqara – no. 2 – verse 278 – 279

chunks.question: I heard that Islam is against science, technology and development. Is this true?
chunks.answer:
It is 100 % wrong. Islam urges all Muslims to think, look at the miracles in the earth and the universe and in themselves and their creation. There are many Qur'an verses about this.
( 17 ) Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created? ( 18 ) And at the sky - how it is raised?
( 19 ) And at the mountains - how they are erected?
20 ) And at the earth - how it is spread out?
Al Ghashiyah – no.88 – verse 17 – 20
Even the first ever order in Qur'an was “Recite" or "Read"
( 1 ) Recite in the name of your Lord who created - ( 2 ) Created man from a clinging substance.
( 3 ) Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous - ( 4 ) Who taught by the pen -
( 5 ) Taught man that which he knew not.
Al 'Alaq – no. 96 – verse 1 – 5
"	and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
Ta Ha – no.20 – verse 114
Say, "Are those who know and those who do not know equal?" Only those possessed of reason will remember.
Az Zumar – no. 39 – verse 9
Even more, Allah give reverence and commendation to those who have knowledge
"	Allah will raise those who have believed among you and
those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
Al Mujadilah – no. 58 – verse 11
In addition, Qura'n includes many verses with scientific allusions and hints. These are only few of them:
( 30 ) Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
Al Anbiya" – no. 21 – verse 30
( 31 ) And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
( 32 ) And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.
Al Anbiya" – no. 21 – verse 31 – 32
( 27 ) Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.
( 28 ) And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allah, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
Fatir – no.35 – verse 27 – 28
You can refer to Qur’an if you need to read more verses that refer to Science. Qura’n is not meant to be a science book. It is primarily a divine book to teach people the true religion and the true belief. However, it had many verses that has scientific denotations and connotations to show people the powers of Allah and to urge them to think about His innumerable blessings upon people.

metadata.category: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.

chunks.type: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.
chunks.question: How should I react as a Muslim if someone wanted to beat me, kill me or take my property or money?
chunks.answer:
Allah and His messenger consider your life and your property as very precious and protected. You can defend yourself and your property with all means. Listen to this Hadeeth:
A person came to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said: Messenger of Allah, what do you think if a man comes to me in order to appropriate my possession? He (the Holy Prophet) said: Don't surrender your possession to him. He (the inquirer) said: If he fights me? He (the Holy Prophet) remarked: Then fight (with him). He (the inquirer) again said: What do you think if I am killed? He (the Holy Prophet) observed: You would be a martyr. He (the inquirer) said: What do you think of him (Messenger of Allah) If I kill him. He (the Holy Prophet) said: he would be in the Fire.
Sahih Muslim 140 - Book 1, Hadith 267

metadata.category: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.

chunks.type: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.
chunks.question: I heard that Islam is against being rich or making business. It recommends for a Muslim to lead a poor and simple life. Is this true?
chunks.answer:
No, it is totally wrong. If all Muslims were to be poor, then they would be enslaved by the unbelievers. Money is very important in life. Islam does not prohibit or discourage being rich as long as you are paying your zakat and sadakat to the poor. Allah want the money to be in your hand, not in your heart. He want you to use the money for your own benefit and your family's benefit and your community's benefit as well. And He warn people against accumulating money and making treasures because the main benefit of money in Islam is to circulate in society.
When money circulates by making businesses, creating jobs, giving salaries and offering services and products, the society becomes healthy and economically strong and vice versa.
Even, another way of money circulation is privileged in Islam. That is, giving an amount of money to the poor so that the people who
are unable to earn money for one reason or another are protected in society and at the same time, the rich are protected against the poor people’s envy and evil.
In short, it is not bad in Islam to be rich, but it is very dangerous on your destiny if you accumulate money greedily. Allah warn these people in some verses of Qur'an:
34 ……And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the
way of Allah - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
( 35 ) The Day when it will be heated in the fire of Hell and seared therewith will be their foreheads, their flanks, and their backs, [it will be said], "This is what you hoarded for yourselves, so taste what you used to hoard."
At Tawbah – no.9 – verse 34 – 35
( 15 ) No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell], ( 16 ) A remover of exteriors.
( 17 ) It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
( 18 ) And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
Al Ma'arij – no. 70 – verse 15 – 18

metadata.category: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.

chunks.type: Section C – Questions about widespread accusations against Islam and misconceptions about Allah's laws in this life.
chunks.question: I heard that sexual freedom is very limited in Islam. It prohibits dating, homosexuality, lesbianism. It only allows marriage and with specific regulations. is this true?
chunks.answer:
Yes, marriage is the only acceptable way of making a sexual relationship in Islam, but this is surely for the benefit and welfare of all people. By forbidding adultery and fornication, Allah wanted to save and protect the Muslim society. When illegal sexual relations spread in a society, this society is destroyed gradually. Even more,
the society dwindles and fades bit by bit. In addition, dangerous incurable diseases become epidemic.
In fact, homosexuality and lesbianism are big atrocities in Islam. They are an utter distortion of Allah's creation and a stoppage to the natural reproduction of the human race. Allah warned any people who accept and legalize these actions in their societies with torment, torture and destruction in this life and the Hereafter.
At the same time, Allah permitted legal marriage and advocated it. Even for those who need more than one wife for one reason or another, Allah granted them this right, but obliged them with fairness and many duties in return so that the wives’ rights can be protected in polygamy against any unfair practices by men.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Why didn’t Allah enable us to see Him, see paradise and hellfire with our own eyes in this life? Maybe most people would be believers in this case?
chunks.answer:
To start with, it is Allah’s destiny that He, Almighty, Eternal Paradise and Eternal Hellfire are unseen for us in our earthly life. So, Allah’s laws can never be discussed, but we still can think to understand some of His wisdom behind this or that law.
If we could see all the unseen, Allah, Paradise and hellfire with our own eyes, the test would be meaningless. Allah preordained that we should believe in the unseen in this life in order to be true believers.
On the day of Resurrection, people will see the unseen and all of them will believe. But their belief will not be beneficial to them at that time. This verse describes this decisive moment when the unbelievers are presented to the Hellfire and they hope to get back to life in order to be believers.
( 27 ) If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."
Al An'am – no.6 – verse 27
( 12 ) Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
Al Mulk – no. 67 – verse 12
( 3 )	Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them,
Al Baqarah – no.2 – verse 3
When Prophet Muhammad was asked about "Faith"
"Inform me about Iman (faith)." He (the Prophet) answered, "It is that you believe in Allah and His angels and His Books and His Messengers and in the Last Day, and in fate (qadar), both in its good and in its evil aspects."
40 Hadith Nawawi 2 - Hadith 2
It is obvious that all the elements of “Iman” or “Faith” mentioned by Prophet Muhammad in the previous “Hadeeth” are elements of the “Unseen”. So, in short, the Islamic belief is based on believing what you cannot see with your eyes. The lexical meaning of the word “Iman” itself means to believe something you did not see with your eyes.
In short, Allah’s big test for people in this life is based on this kind of
belief. To believe in the unseen that Allah had told us about.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: If prophet Muhammad was a prophet to all humanity, then what about other nations and people who lived before prophet Muhammad?
chunks.answer:
Prophet Muhammad was sent to humanity from his time to the Last Day. But, Allah sent prophets and messengers to every nation since the beginning of history until the time of Prophet Muhammad. All these prophets and messengers came to their nations with the same message: "Worship and obey Allah and his messengers in every detail of your life. Believe in the Last Day and Eternal Paradise and Eternal Hellfire".
When it was the time of Prophet Muhammad, he also came with the same message that all his predecessors came with. The only difference was the way Allah should be worshipped and some other legislations that are suitable for every nation and every age.
Allah decreed that it was the right time to send one prophet to all
humanity. Definitely, Allah has His own wisdom in doing this whether we discern it or not.
Allah will not ask us about these previous nations and what they did. Only Allah know everything about them and will evaluate them accordingly. We will be evaluated according to our own deeds only. Allah is fair enough.
These facts are mentioned in many Qur’anic verses:
" That was a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do."
Al Baqarah– no. – verse 134
"Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger."
Al Isra – no. 17 – verse 15
"Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner."
Fatir – no. 35 - verse 24
"And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned."
Al Isra – no. 17 – verse 36

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: And how did these nations react to their prophets' messages? Did they believe and follow them?
chunks.answer:
In fact, most of the nations mentioned in Qur’an belied, disobeyed and betrayed their prophets. Some people believed but they were a few in every nation. Allah destroyed and obliterated all the unbelievers; generation after generation. For Allah created people mainly to worship Him. And if they do not, He eradicate them at the time He want.
These facts are mentioned in Qur’an in many verses:
"And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus, do We recompense the criminal people."
Yunus – no. 10 – verse 13
"And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing."
Al Isra – no. 17 – verse 17
"And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?"
Maryam – no.19 – verse 98
" But none had believed with him, except a few."
Hud – No.11 - verse 40
The previous verse is speaking about Prophet Noah and his people.
"Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman. Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people. So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed. And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers. And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me. I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength."
Adh Dhariyat– no. 51 – verse 52 – 58

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But why did most people in other nations refuse the message of their prophets to believe in their creator and obey Him?
chunks.answer:
One of the main reasons for this was arrogance. Some of them were bragging about their fortunes. Others were boasting about their powers and abilities. Others preferred to follow their unbeliever ancestors blindly. And others were so arrogant that they refused to be equivalent to the poor people. But, they forgot, foolishly, that their powers and fortunes were blessings from Allah. Blessings that could be deprived at any time by the commands of Allah and without any prior notice.
Another major reason was their disbelief in the resurrection and the Last Day. They couldn’t figure out the simple fact that the one who created them the first time is, surely, able to resurrect them again easily after death.
Qur’an talks about these different reasons repeatedly:
"And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So, see how was the end of the corrupters."
An Naml– no.27 – verse 14
"[Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration."
Fatir – no.35 – verse 43
"And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."
Az Zukhruf– no. 43 – verse 23
"And they said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."
Saba – no.34 – verse 35
"And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped." But, [in fact], Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe."
Al Baqarah- no.2 – verse 88

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Why didn't Allah annihilate the disobeyers and the corrupt people especially that the earth is replete with oppression and Allah is fair?
chunks.answer:
Allah told us the reason very clearly and reasonably in Qur’an:
"And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing."
Fatir – no. 35 – verse 45
"And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it]."
An Nahl – no.16 – verse 61

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Why were many of Allah's messengers and Prophets from the Middle East, the Arab Peninsula, Iraq, Syria and Palestine?
chunks.answer:
Not all of them were from the Middle East, but maybe the most prominent of them were. Surely, Allah has His wisdom in doing this. Maybe this area was the heart of the world at that time. So, it was more qualified to be the starting point for spreading Allah's messages. Maybe because of the nature of people living in this area. Maybe other reasons. Anyway, it is Allah's choice.
Definitely, the prophets who are mentioned in the Torah, the Gospel and Qur'an are not all the prophets of Allah to humanity in all ages. The ones mentioned are only a small number. These are the ones Allah wanted to tell us about. But surely, there are many other prophets- unknown to us- who were sent to peoples in islands, far-away countries and deserted places in different ages. So, not all of Allah's prophets are from the Middle East
Allah say these facts briefly in Qur'an:
( 78 ) And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, it will be concluded in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].
Ghafir – no. 40 – verse 78
So, prophets are so many. We know a number of them. Many of them are not mentioned in the Divine revelations. Allah state that He had sent a prophet in each single nation along human history.
( 24 ) Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
Fatir – no.35 – verse 24

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But some people become more wealthy and powerful as they become more corrupt and atheist. Isn't this surprising?
chunks.answer:
Yes, this is true, but it is not surprising when one remembers the most fundamental law of this worldly life: testing. This life was created as a place of trial, not as the final destination. The real and eternal life is the Hereafter.

Because this life is a test, its outcomes are not based on justice alone. As a result, one may see righteous and pious people oppressed, tortured, or even killed, while tyrannical, arrogant, and unbelieving individuals enjoy wealth, health, power, and long lives.

Allah gives everyone sufficient time to complete their test in full, because there will be no second chance, no retesting, and no repetition on the Day of Judgment. Every soul will face the consequences of its choices with absolute justice in the Hereafter.

At times, Allah may even increase the wealth and power of arrogant and corrupt people, not as a sign of His pleasure, but as a form of gradual misguidance. Their arrogance grows, their sins increase, and thus their punishment in the Hereafter becomes complete and fully deserved. This is part of Allah’s wisdom and justice.

This profound reality is mentioned repeatedly in the Qur'an.

Allah says:

"But those who deny Our signs – We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know. And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm."
Al-A‘raf – no. 7 – verses 182–183

Allah also clarifies that worldly wealth has no real value compared to the Hereafter:

"And if it were not that the people would become one community [of disbelievers], We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful – for their houses – ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount, and for their houses – doors and couches [of silver] upon which to recline, and gold ornaments. But all that is nothing but the enjoyment of worldly life. And the Hereafter with your Lord is for the righteous."
Az-Zukhruf – no. 43 – verses 33–35

Allah further exposes the false assumption that wealth and children are signs of divine approval:

"And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me. But the people divided their religion among them into sects – each faction rejoicing in what it has. So leave them in their confusion for a time. Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children is because We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive."
Al-Mu’minun – no. 23 – verses 52–56

Therefore, wealth, power, and worldly success are not indicators of truth, righteousness, or divine pleasure. They are part of the test. True success is measured in faith, obedience, patience, and the final outcome on the Day of Resurrection.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: What about other planets in the galaxy? Are there creatures like us who have a Last Day, Paradise, and Hellfire? Could there be creatures who are being tested like us on other planets?
chunks.answer:
I cannot provide a definitive answer to this question. There may be other creatures, and there may not. However, in any case, knowing this is not useful for us. We were created for a specific purpose, and our focus should be on fulfilling that purpose.

Spending time speculating about unknown creatures in other worlds will only distract us from our responsibilities in this life, wasting valuable opportunities to earn good deeds for the Last Day. Knowledge of such matters will not benefit us in the Hereafter.

Allah advises in the Qur’an regarding this natural curiosity of humans:

"And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight, and the heart – about all those [one] will be questioned."
Al-Isra – no. 17 – verse 36

Thus, our concern should remain focused on what we have been tasked with in this life: obeying Allah, following His guidance, and preparing for the eternal life of the Hereafter.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: I sometimes do not understand some of the Qur’an verses. Why are some verses not clear enough in meaning to everyone?
chunks.answer:
( 7 ) It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them].
And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord." And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.
Al 'Imran– no. 3 – verse 7
As the verse states, some of the Quranic verses are specific and precise so that everyone can understand even the illiterate and very simple people. Those are the verses that talk about the qualities of Allah, our creator and why we were created and what waits for us after this life. These verses about the basic beliefs are very precise because they are the basics of the book and the basics of Islam. The other kind of verses is "unspecific". Their real meanings are only known by Allah and- may be - some of the knowledgeable scholars. But those who have deviation and corruption in their hearts always focus on these "unspecific" verses and try to interpret them as they like because they are inherently corrupt and they do not want to follow the right way.
Qur'an is the word of Allah. It is miraculous in every aspect. It is intended to be a miracle for people in every age and in every culture. So, if all the Qur'anic verses had specific and clear meanings as you said, the miraculous aspects would disappear. Some verses should be ambiguous for some people in every age so that the miracle will continue to the last day of this world.
And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind has not been given of knowledge except a little."
Al Isra"– no. 17 – verse 85

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But some verses in this Qur'an are similar or confusing and scholars did not agree about some verdicts. What should Muslims do about this?
chunks.answer:
The sources of legislation in Islam are four: They are respectively: Qur'an, Sunnah, consensus of Islamic scholars and comparing known incidents to new incidents using tools of Islamic legislation. So, for example, if a scholar is trying to find an Islamic ruling for any incident, he will search Qura'n first. If he did not find in Qur'an, he will search in Sunnah. If he did not find in sunnah, he will check if there is any consensus about this case among scholars. If he didn't find a consensus, he should compare the new incident to old ones using specific tools of legislation and fiqh.
So, in short, an ordinary Muslim. That is, a Muslim who is not a scholar should always ask scholars about the right ruling in Islam for a specific case or the meaning of a specific verse. On the other hand, if a Muslim is a scholar, or at least has the right skills and tools to search for the right ruling, he can count on himself in doing this, especially that nowadays information is available on websites, applications and printed books.
Allah instructed us in Qur’an to ask the knowledgeable people if
we do not know.
"( 43 ) And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know."
An Nahl– no.16 – verse 43
"( 18 ) Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allah has guided, and those are people of understanding." Az Zumar– no. 39 – verse 18

chunks.question: Do Allah know everything that happen in this world? And do He know everything that will happen?
chunks.answer:
Definitely, Allah is all-knowledgeable. Everything in this universe from the tiniest to the hugest is fully and comprehensively known to Him.
Allah mentioned this fact many times in Qur’an:
"( 29 ) Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah know it. And He know that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent."

chunks.question: And if Allah know everything before it happens and everything that will happen, and he know who are paradise dwellers and hellfire dwellers, so why is this life with all its tortures then death then resurrection and evaluation? He could have put paradise dwellers in their places and hellfire dwellers in their places from the beginning?
chunks.answer:
Allah wanted to give everyone the due and sufficient chance to show his believing and his deeds so that he cannot have excuses on the Day of Resurrection.
Qur’an verses answer this question clearly and reasonably:
"( 134 ) And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

"( 47 ) And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"

chunks.question: Is there a difference between What Allah doom on people as destiny like believer or unbeliever, rich or poor, healthy or sick …etc. and what Allah like? I mean Do Allah always like what he destiny for people?
chunks.answer: 80	Yes, there is a great difference between what Allah destiny on people and what Allah like for them. For example, Allah like for all his creatures to be believers and enter paradise and avoid hellfire and live happily in this life and the Hereafter. But, he destiny on many of them to be unbelievers and suffer in this life and the Hereafter. Allah do not like this bad destiny for them but He doomed it for them because He know – as He is All- knowing- they deserve it because they did not believe in Him and did not follow his Messengers. Allah granted everyone the free choice and to be a believer or unbeliever and they chose the dark way. So, they deserved Allah's destiny. And remember that Allah is all-fair. And he has no advantage in making these specific people unbelievers or those specific people believers. But they choose freely for themselves during their lives and Allah destiny them what they choose.

chunks.question: But the human mind sometimes contradicts with some of the Islamic decrees. How does Islam handle this problem?
chunks.answer:
The human mind sometimes clashes with some Islamic decrees because he thinks that they are against his interests. This usually happens as a result of lack of knowledge or lack of faith. If you have strong faith and knowledge, you will feel certain that Allah's decrees for you are the best for your interests. And if you have some knowledge, you will learn that Allah's decrees are the best too. But faith is more secure for you. It will make you safer and happier.
However, knowledge is dangerous and insecure because you cannot always get the correct and sufficient knowledge.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Some people assume that Allah created the unbelievers as they are and created their fate. So, it is out of their control to be believers. As a result, they think it is unfair to throw unbelievers in hellfire in the end. How do you see this logic?
chunks.answer:
Allah is all-fair. He do not need to oppress any of his creatures. He gave every one an even chance to be a believer or unbeliever.
And Allah knew that unbelievers would make this allegation. So, he answered them in Qur'an a long time ago and He asked them to prove their allegations if they could:
( 148 ) Those who associated with Allah will say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything." Likewise, did those before deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying."
Al An'am – No. 6 – verse 148
Then Allah unfolded to them what He did with their souls to implant monotheism in their inherent natures before he had created their bodies. Definitely, this act was fair enough for everyone. Allah implanted the seed of monotheism in every human before he or she was born. Then, during his or her life on Earth, they had the free will to make their choices. Of course, the details of these processes and how they were done is known only by Allah.
( 172 ) And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
( 173 ) Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
Al A'raf – No. 7 – verse 172 , 173

chunks.question: And what does Qur'an say about wars, plagues, natural disasters, calamities and economic breakdowns that happen everywhere around the world. And thousands or maybe millions of people who suffer or die as a result?
chunks.answer:
Everything that happens in this world is thoroughly controlled by Allah and destined by Him. Every incident whether trivial or significant has wisdom and logic behind it. But whatever wise and knowledgeable you were, you will never be able to understand the wisdom or the logic behind everything that happens in this world.
So, the safe way is to submit thoroughly to the power and wisdom of Allah and to think that there is ultimate wisdom and full righteousness behind His deeds whether it is clear for us or not. To believe from all your heart that Allah is fair and he never oppress humans.
And any injustice you see in this life with your eyes is a direct result of your lack of knowledge and lack of wisdom. Every single human will be evaluated fairly in front of his Lord in the Hereafter. And those who were oppressed or persecuted or killed by other people in this world will take their full rights and rewards in front of their Lord.
Allah Explain this in Qur’an:
"( 22 ) No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy -
( 23 ) In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful –"
Al Hadid– no. 57 – verse 22 – 23
"if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted, but Allah is full of bounty to the worlds."
Al Baqarah– no. 2 – verse 251
"( 30 ) And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much."
Ash-Shura– no.42 – verse 30
"( 11 ) No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things."
At Taghabun– no. 64 – verse 11
"( 40 ) Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward."
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 40

chunks.question: As a Muslim, how can you keep yourself safe and sound from all these world calamities and problems?
chunks.answer:
There is no way to keep yourself safe and sound from calamities and problems, but there is a way to keep yourself happy in the middle of them.
The answer is in Qu'ran and Sunnah:
Allah assure you that anything that will happen to you is preordained and written in a book. Nothing is haphazard or unplanned. Allah advise you to accept his fate whatever it was because it is the only way to be content and satisfied during your earthly life.
( 22 ) No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy -
( 23 ) In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful
Al Hadid – No. 57 – verse 22,23
And in this hadeeth, prophet Muhammad (PBUH) promises all believers with expiating their sins in return for every calamity or illness that may stricken them whatever minor it was.
Abu Sa'id and Abu Hurairah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
"Never a believer is stricken with a discomfort, an illness, an anxiety, a grief or mental worry or even the pricking of a thorn but Allah will
expiate his sins on account of his patience".
Sahih Muslim 2572
In-book reference: Book 45, Hadith 63

chunks.question: How should Muslims deal with unfair and cruel rulers, kings or presidents? What is Islam's stance about this?
chunks.answer:
I think it is not wise or proper to demonstrate or challenge with force against unfair rulers, kings or presidents because this will result in more misery, more slaying, more chaos and more weakness and poverty for any nation.
Some people think that if they demonstrate against that president or this king and force him out of office in one way or another, everything will change and justice will prevail but this is totally untrue because corruption is not usually the product of one person. It is often the product of a whole system. The leader or the politician is only the tip of the iceberg. If you remove the tip, the iceberg is still there under the water unseen and much more dangerous than the tip you removed. The iceberg will develop scores of tips of the same kind.
In other words, even if you succeed in getting rid of the alleged corrupt leader, the system that produced this or that leader and supported him is still there and it will produce similar leaders with new names and faces. And the system itself consists of people from this society. So, The system and the people are somewhat related.
In fact, there is no fast or magical way to get rid of the corruption and deviation of the political leaders and systems. The only correct and safe way is to be pious and obey Allah sincerely and bring up your children in a good way. This will change our rulers to better ones on the long run.
This kind of change can be done on the long run only. However, it can never be done in elections or coups because the corrupt system produces different names with the same corruption. And it always protects its men from under the table. It will be very dangerous to risk challenging the system. This may result in civil wars, unrest and more corruption and misery. And this happened repeatedly throughout history. We should start with ourselves, correct our lives, and correct our relation with our creator and with people. Moreover, we should bring up our children well and be patient. Change will come if we do this. Definitely, it will come but it will come slowly.
Sadly, the bad and corrupt rulers may be a punishment from Allah to a corrupt society. So, returning back to your religion and to your creator and repenting is the best possible way on the long run.
And here are lots of evidence from Qur’an and Sunnah about obeying the leaders even if they were unfair:
( 59 ) O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.
An Nisa – no.4 – verse 59
Wa'il bin Hujr (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Salamah bin Yazid Al-Ju'f (May Allah be pleased with him) asked Messenger of Allah (ﷺ): "O Prophet of Allah! Tell us, what you command us to do if there arises over us rulers who demand of us what is due to them and refuse us what is due to us." Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) turned away from him, but he repeated the same question. Thereupon Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Listen to them and obey them. They are responsible for their obligations and you are accountable	for	yours."
[Muslim]. Book 1 – Hadeeth 669
Narrated `Abdullah:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to us, "You will see after me, selfishness (on the part of other people) and other matters that you will disapprove of." They asked, "What do you order us to do, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)? (under such circumstances)?" He said, "Pay their rights to them (to the rulers) and ask your right from Allah."
Sahih al-Bukhari 7052 - Book 92, Hadith 5
Narrated Ibn `Abbas:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Whoever disapproves of something done by his ruler then he should be patient, for whoever disobeys the ruler even a little (little = a span) will die as those who died in the Pre- lslamic Period of Ignorance. (i.e. as rebellious Sinners).
Sahih al-Bukhari 7053 - Book 92, Hadith 6
Anas (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "Hear and obey even if an Abyssinian slave whose head is like a raisin is placed in authority over you."
[Al- Bukhari] – Book 1 – Hadeeth 666

chunks.question: And what does Islam say about the great disparity among people in wealth and property in this life? Some people do not find their daily meals while others own billions.
chunks.answer:
Qur’an answered this question very clearly and expressed amazement at the people who challenge the wisdom and power of Allah and ask: “Why did He give this person? “Why did he deprive that one?
"( 62 ) Allah extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed, Allah is, of all things, Knowing."
Al 'Ankabut– no. 29 – verse 62
Here are some logical reasons for not making everyone rich. They are mentioned clearly in Qur’an:
"( 32 ) Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate."
Az Zukhruf– no. 43 – verse 32
"( 27 ) And if Allah had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed, He is, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."
Ash-Shura– no. 42 – verse 27
In the first verse, Allah inform us that the disparity in wealth and fortunes among people is very necessary for the economies to survive. In other words, every economy needs the poor people who are usually workers and the middle people who are usually employees or small entrepreneurs and the rich people who are usually the large investors. It is common sense that in any project, you need the three types of people. And it is unimaginable and unrealistic to think of a society of rich people only. Who would be the workers and employees, then? Or to imagine a society of poor people only. Who would invest in projects and recruit them, then?
In the second verse, Allah explain that if He extended wealth excessively to His servants, they would be tyrannous and oppression will prevail.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Are you sure the creator is just and fair 100% with all of us in spite of the great disparities in wealth, health, life span, fortunes, destiny and everything? How can He be fair with everyone in spite of the great disparities among people in everything? Give me evidence.
chunks.answer:
Logically, the creator of this universe with billions of creatures and humans must be fair. Being fair needs someone to be: self-sufficient, all-knowing, all- powerful and unbiased. And because humans usually lack all these qualities, they are usually unfair with one another. But Allah is completely different. Allah has all the super qualities of knowledge, power, self-sufficiency. Actually, He do not need to be unfair. And if he is unfair, his injustice would be too hard to bear because He is all-powerful.
Life in this world and the disparity among people in wealth, health and power are not an accurate measurement at all because Allah stated in many Quranic verses that life for him is nothing and that He may give the unbelievers a lot of wealth and health in this life.
However, believers may be poor and sick. It is all a big test.
These facts are stated in Qur'an in different verses:
( 40 ) Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.
An Nisa – no. 4 – verse 40
( 44 ) Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who are wronging themselves.
Yunus – no. 10 – verse 44
( 22 ) And Allah created the heavens and earth in truth and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
Al Jathiyah – No. 45 – verse 22
( 49 ) And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except
that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
Al Kahf– no.18 – verse 49
( 55 ) Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
( 56 ) Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.
Al Mu"minun– no. 23 – verses 55 –56
( 44 ) So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
( 45 ) And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
Al Qalam– no.68 – verse 44 – 45
All the previous verses state that Allah may give the unbelievers in this life much wealth, health and power only to lead them progressively to the eternal punishment they deserve because they were blind about his signs and his messengers.
So, a lot of blessings do not mean that Allah love you. On the contrary, many calamities do not mean that Allah hate you. Simply Allah is testing everyone with which is suitable for His servant.
