chunks.question: Well, why didn't Allah force all of us to be believers? He could do this of course.
chunks.answer:
Allah could do this of course. But we stated previously that Allah meant to test us in this life. And the believers will be rewarded while the unbelievers will be punished. But if Allah forced people to be believers, the test would be meaningless and the rewards or the punishments would be pointless and unfair. Giving people the free will to choose is what makes sense for everything in this life and the Hereafter.
The answer is in Qur’an in different ways:
"Had Allah willed, He would have made you one nation [united in religion], but [He intended] to test you in what He has given you; so race to [all that is] good. To Allah is your return all together, and He will [then] inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."

( 35 ) And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if Allah had willed, He would have united them upon guidance. So never be of the ignorant."

"( 106 ) Follow, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allah.

chunks.question: Why did Allah create Satan and let him and his offspring live until the Last Day. However, He know that Satan will deviate humans and stop them from worshipping Allah? Why did He create the evil? However, He is the all-fair and merciful?
chunks.answer:
You learnt previously that the main target behind this life is to test people. And the test can be with good or evil as the verse states
( 35 ) Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
Al Anbiya" – no. 21 – verse 35
So, if trial or testing was the main target, it is very logical that Allah create Satan and kinds of evil in this life. In order to have a test, there should be a struggle. And in order to have a struggle, there must be good and evil. If only good and righteousness existed on Earth, the test or trial would be meaningless.
Originally, Satan was a pious worshipper to Allah. And when Allah created Adam, He asked all angels to prostrate to Adam. All angels obeyed Allah except Satan. Allah asked him why he did not obey the order.
Allah tell us the full story in the following verses:
( 32 ) [Allah] said, O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"
( 34 ) [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.
( 36 ) He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
( 37 ) [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved	 ( 38 ) Until the Day of the time well-known."
( 39 ) [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all
( 40 ) Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
( 41 ) [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight. ( 42 ) Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.
( 43 ) And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.	 ( 44 ) It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."

chunks.question: But many people were born in unbeliever families, not Muslims and in countries far away from Islam? Or they had no idea about the true religion. How will these people be evaluated?
chunks.answer:
Allah made the sound belief of monotheism inherent in all human beings. It is an uncorrupted concept inherent in everyone that there is a creator for this world whom we have to obey when we are born. So, all human beings around the globe are born with this sound and uncorrupted instinct that we have to believe in the creator of this world and obey him. But, then, his parents make him a Jew or a Christian or any other religion when he grows up. Still, the true guidance or the heavenly compass is still inside him which always tell him: "There is a creator for this world. And the creator want you to be a Muslim. Allah gave him the choice to follow his inherent true instinct or his fathers' and grandfathers' belief and he will be accounted for his choice of course.
The following verses and hadeeth explain these facts:
"( 172 ) And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
( 173 ) Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
( 174 ) And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return."
Al A'raf– no. 7 – verse 172 – 174
Narrated Abu Huraira:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Every child is born with a true faith of Islam (i.e. to worship none but Allah Alone) and his parents convert him to Judaism or Christianity or Magianism, as an animal delivers a perfect baby animal. Do you find it mutilated?"
Sahih al-Bukhari 1385
In-book reference: Book 23, Hadith 137
Still, we have a problem. What if someone has never heard about Islam throughout his life? The assumption is improbable. But let’s assume it could happen. In this case, Allah know what this person would have done if he heard about Islam. Allah will never oppress him surely. Allah has His own way of doing justice with his servants.
The following hadeeth answers this question:
Narrated Abu Huraira:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "No child is born but has the Islamic Faith, but its parents turn it into a Jew or a Christian. It is as you help the animals give birth. Do you find among their offspring a mutilated one before you mutilate them yourself?" The people said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! What do you think about those (of them) who die young?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Allah knows what they would have done (were they to live)."
Sahih al-Bukhari 6599, 6600
In-book reference: Book 82, Hadith 6

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But I saw many Muslims around the world who were dishonest and liars. I saw other Muslims who were corrupt and villains. How do you explain that?
chunks.answer:
Yes, this kind of people is really there everywhere. These people are not real Muslims. Islam is not by what is written in your ID. Islam is what you believe and what you practice in your everyday life.
Many people are only Muslims by their ID, but they do not follow the teachings of Islam or their prophet's Sunnah. Do not judge Islam by these hypocrites. You should evaluate Islam by the basics and the regulations of Islam. Moreover, people are getting more corrupt as the time passes forward up to the Last Day. This means that corruption and corrupted people are on the rise. This is a bitter fact we have to admit and adapt to. Actually, it is part of the big test we have to undergo in this life that we should live and deal with lots of hypocrites and corrupt people.
There are many verses and Hadeeths that talk about this issue:
( 41 ) Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].
Ar Rum – no. 30 – verse 41
Ibn 'Umar reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying:
You would find people like one hundred camels and you would not find even one (camel) fit for riding.
Sahih Muslim 2547
Book 44, Hadith 328
Book 31, Hadith 6179
Explanation: The hadeeth refers to the rarity of true good people whom you can accompany or befriend. The prophet (MPBUH) compared the righteous and honest people whom you can trust to the camel that is fit for riding which is very rare among other camels.
Narrated Hudhaifa:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) narrated to us two narrations, one of which I have seen (happening) and I am waiting for the other. He narrated that honesty was preserved in the roots of the hearts of men (in the beginning) and then they learnt it (honesty) from the Qur'an, and then they learnt it from the (Prophet's) Sunna (tradition). He also told us about its disappearance, saying, "A man will go to sleep whereupon honesty will be taken away from his heart, and only its trace will remain, resembling the traces of fire. He then will sleep whereupon the remainder of the honesty will also be taken away (from his heart) and its trace will resemble a blister which is raised over the surface of skin, when an ember touches one's foot; and in fact, this blister does not contain anything. So there will come a day when people will deal in business with each other but there will hardly be any trustworthy persons among them. Then it will be said that in such- and-such a tribe there is such-and-such person who is honest, and a man will be admired for his intelligence, good manners and strength, though indeed he will not have belief equal to a mustard seed in his heart." The narrator added: There came upon me a time when I did not mind dealing with anyone of you, for if he was a Muslim, his religion would prevent him from cheating; and if he was a Christian, his Muslim ruler would prevent him from cheating; but today I cannot deal except with so-and-so and so-and-so. (See Hadith No. 208, Vol. 9)
Sahih al-Bukhari 6497
Book 81, Hadith 86
Vol. 8, Book 76, Hadith 504
Narrated `Imran bin Husain:
"Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'The best of my followers are those living in my generation (i.e. my contemporaries). and then those who will follow the latter" `Imran added, "I do not remember whether he mentioned two or three generations after his generation, then the Prophet (ﷺ) added, 'There will come after you, people who will bear witness without being asked to do so, and will be treacherous and untrustworthy, and they will vow and never fulfill their vows, and fatness will appear among them."
Sahih al-Bukhari 3650 -	Book 62, Hadith 2 -	Vol. 5, Book 57, Hadith 2

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: What if I wait until the Last Day come and then I can see the resurrection, paradise and hellfire with my own eyes to be sure 100% of what you say. At this time, I think I will believe and be a Muslim. Will being a Muslim save me at this time?
chunks.answer:
The true faith is that you believe in "the unseen"
as Allah said. This kind of faith is the required one and the one which makes you enter Paradise and brings you happiness in this life and the Hereafter. But if you believe when you see everything with your eyes on the Last Day, this is not considered "believing" because you saw with your eyes. And it will not be accepted from you at this time as Allah stated. When angels come to an unbeliever for death and he sees everything at this time. He sees the angels, paradise and Hellfire, he knows the truth and he implore to be given another chance in life to make good deeds. But it is too late.
Allah describe this hard moment in these verses:
"( 99 ) [For such is the state of the disbelievers], until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
( 100 ) That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected."
Al Mu"minun – no. 23 – verse 99,100
True believing is that you believe what Allah say to you before you see with your eyes. And you can have proofs for the unseen from what you see with your eyes in this life like Allah's creatures, bounties and provisions for humans and non-humans. And that Allah created everything in this universe with ultimate wisdom.
Example1: Allah created you in this world and provided for you from all blessings. This is something you can see and feel.
So, you should believe Him, when He tell you that he will create you again after death to evaluate your deeds in life.
Why do you consider it unbelievable or strange to be created again? He created you the first time from tiny spermatozoa that you cannot see with your naked eye. This spermatozoon was pushed out from your father's urethra to your mother's womb to settle there for nine months and then it was you; A human being living, walking
and thinking. All this happened with Allah's ultimate power. No doctors or parents are able to control anything from all this. Aren't all these proofs for you to believe Him when He tell you something that will happen and you cannot see it right now? And here you are living and enjoying his blessings and argue about your creator's existence at the same time as it is stated in these great verses:
"( 77 ) Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?
( 78 ) And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"
( 79 ) Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
Ya Sin – no. 36 – verse 77 – 79
"( 64 ) Is He [not best] who begins creation and then repeats it and who provides for you from the heaven and earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."
An Naml- no. 27 – verse 64
Explanation:
Allah ask and challenge every human: Do you know another God or creator other than Allah who creates from nothing and provides for his creatures? If you know, please tell us and give us your proofs.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But it is hard for me to believe that billions of people on this planet from different nationalities are astray and on the wrong way because they are non-Muslims. And that only Muslims are on the right track and they have the true religion; however, they are fewer in number and in power.
chunks.answer:
This has always been the habit throughout history. The followers of the prophets and the faithful adherents to the true religion were few in numbers everywhere throughout history. For example, prophet "Noah" only a few people believed him. Likewise, Abraham, Lut, Hud, Saleh and even Moses. All prophets were met by denial, refraining and mockery. Jesus was convicted of lying and using magic and all the repeated convictions. Then finally they conspired to kill him but Allah saved him from their hands. Even prophet
Muhammad encountered from his people in Makkah very strong refraining and harming. They besieged his tribe for three years to force them to abandon this religion. Even, they tried to kill him. But Allah destined victory for his religion and its followers in the end.
This has always been and will always be the habit of people. The adherents of the true religion are few in numbers. They suffer a lot from the majority. They are tortured and convicted of false crimes and names. But in the end, they will be the victorious and the winning people either in this life and the Hereafter or in the Hereafter only. It depends on Allah’s destiny for everyone. It is the law of Allah to test the believers in this life.
Allah state this law in these verses:
"( 2 ) Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?
( 3 ) But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars."
Al 'Ankabut– no. 29 – verse 2,3
When Allah talk about the believers and the righteous people in Qur'an, they are always described as "few" in number:
"( 40 ) [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few.
( 41 ) And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
Hud – no. 11 – verse 40 – 41
"( 62 ) [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."
Al Isra – no. 17 – verse 62
( 78 ) And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
Al Mu"minun– no. 23 – verse 78
On the contrary, when Allah talk about the unbelievers or the people who follow their communities’ or parents' belief blindly and without any authentication or justification, they are always described as "most" or "majority"
"( 116 ) And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
Al An'am– no.6 – verse 116
"( 44 ) Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way."
Al Furqan– no. 25 – verse 44
"( 73 ) And indeed, your Lord is full of bounty for the people, but
most of them do not show gratitude."
An Naml– no.27 – verse 73
"( 4 ) As a giver of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear."
Fussilat – no. 41 – verse 4
"( 38 ) And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.
( 39 ) We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know."
Ad Dukhan– no. 44 – verse 38 – 39
So, try to be from the few winners and do not be misguided by the many blind losers.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: What about the non-Muslim famous and great people who helped a lot to improve people's lives across human history like inventors, scientists, artists and leaders. They granted humanity great deeds but most of them were not Muslims. What will be their fate according to Islam?
chunks.answer:
If a man lived and died as an unbeliever, whatever good deeds he made in this life, they will never benefit him in the Last Day. Allah created man primarily to worship and obey his creator. So, this is the main and basic target we were created for. If we do not carry out and maintain the main target, all other great and magnificent deeds or inventions or whatsoever will never benefit us in front of our creator.
Allah said this in Qur'an:
( 21 ) And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
( 22 ) The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
( 23 ) And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
Al Furqan – no. 25 – verse 21 – 23
Explanation:
Allah describe in these verses the arrogant unbelievers in this life who said we will believe only if we see Allah or if He send angels down to us. He say that all their deeds in this life will be as dispersed dust or nothing.
Prophet Muhammad exaggerated this fact in this Hadeeth.
Abu Huraira reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as stating that Allah the Most High and Exalted said:
I am the One, One Who does not stand in need of a partner. If anyone does anything in which he associates anyone else with Me, I shall abandon him with one whom he associates with Allah.
Sahih Muslim - 2985 - In-book reference - Book 55, Hadith 58
Explanation: Allah accept and reward deeds that were done for his sake only. Any deed which was done with intentions other than satisfying the creator, will be discarded whatever this deed was great or beneficial according to humans.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Who appointed you as a judge to deliver verdicts about the great and famous people who developed lives of people and engendered huge changes along human history?
chunks.answer:
I wish I could give you the answer you expected, but I answered you from Qur'an. I am trying to be honest and unbiased. It is not my verdict and I am not a judge. I am only transferring Islam's stance about what you ask as truthfully as I can.
Allah explain in the coming verse that believers must follow what Allah and his messenger decide for them. They have no choice. Even if it doesn't appeal to them.
( 36 ) It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.
Al Ahzab – No. 33 – verse 36

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: Some people imagine different concrete shapes for Allah. I mean they imagine or have a specific illustration for Him in their minds. Is this permissible?
chunks.answer:
It is very dangerous to do this because Allah is different from anything you can imagine. He is the creator of everything. In brief, Allah is beyond our minds. Every Muslim should refrain from imagining a specific shape for Allah because this is considered as a kind of disbelief in the qualities of Allah if it is done repeatedly and intentionally.
If a Muslim's imagination tempts him to imagine Allah in any concrete shape, he should do three things:
1.	Remember this great verse in Qur'an:
"There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing."
Ash-Shura– no.42 – verse 11
2.	Remember that the Divine self of Allah is beyond human minds. And if you want to know how Allah is great, you should think about his creation and look at his huge universe but never think about his Divine self.
3.	Ask Allah for forgiveness and supplicate to Allah to help you get rid of these imaginations.

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But life is full of diversions, fun and joys. It is very hard to keep yourself away from all the impermissible acts in Islam and be patient on obeying Allah. It needs a lot of self-control and self- constraint. Does Qur'an say anything about this?
chunks.answer:
Definitely, you need patience, self-control and perseverance to keep yourself straight on the way especially that Allah will test you in different ways and at different times during this life
Allah answer you in the following verses:
( 200 ) O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.
Al 'Imran – no. 3 – verse 200
"( 2 ) Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?
( 3 ) But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars."
Al 'Ankabut– no. 29 – verse 2,3
"( 142 ) Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while Allah has not yet made evident those of you who fight in His cause and made evident those who are steadfast?"
Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 142
"( 31 ) And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs."
Muhammad – no. 47 – verse 31
"( 155 ) And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient,
( 156 ) Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return."
( 157 ) Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided."
Al Baqarah– no.2 – 155 – 157

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: And how will be this "test" in life? Will it be by illness, poverty and hardships?
chunks.answer:
A test can be by giving people a lot of money, power and health. Also, it can be the opposite, poverty, helplessness, illness. And in each case, Allah want to see how people will do with what they were given. Will they be obedient, thankful and patient or will they be disobedient, insurgent, impatient and corrupt? Surely, Allah know what they will do, but He want to give them the chance and the time to see their deeds with their own eyes and establish the proof so that they do not complain on the Last Day that they were not given the chance to perform good deeds.
This logic is clear in the following verse:
"( 35 ) Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned."
Al Anbiya – no. 21 – verse 35

metadata.category: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.

chunks.type: Section D: Questions about Allah’s destiny and the laws He preordained for humans in this life.
chunks.question: But why is the test different for people? Why are some people tested with good fortunes like richness and power while others are tested with miserable fates like poverty, illness and suffering? Why is it not the same for all people to be fair?
chunks.answer:
Allah know his creatures and know which kind of test is suitable for each one. This is clear in the following verses:
"( 27 ) And if Allah had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed, He is, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."
Ash-Shura– no. 42 – verse 27

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: Is there a difference between the Last Day of this world and the Final Day of Resurrection and Evaluation or are they one day?
chunks.answer:
They are different but related and they will happen in a row. The Last Day of this world will be marked by unimaginable destruction of the planets, the stars and all the celestial bodies in the universe. In addition, all human beings and non-humans will die all of a sudden. Everything will be destroyed and life will be eradicated. Th Final Day of Resurrection will come right after the death and destruction of the whole world when Allah create new heavens and new Earth and resurrect all the dead and everyone is gathered for the longest Day of Judgment to get ready for the eternal life. But there is an unknown period of time between the two great days.
Allah describe this day repeatedly in different verses. Interesting and awesome scenes from this day are depicted in each group of verses
( 48 ) [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
( 49 ) And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,
( 50 ) Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.
( 51 ) So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
Ibrahim – no. 14 – Verse 48 - 51
Note that Allah mingles the incidents of both of them as one day in these verses.
( 1 ) When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness] ( 2 ) And when the stars fall, dispersing,
( 3 ) And when the mountains are removed
( 4 ) And when full-term she-camels are neglected ( 5 ) And when the wild beasts are gathered
( 6 ) And when the seas are filled with flame ( 7 ) And when the souls are paired
( 8 ) And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked ( 9 ) For what sin she was killed
( 10 ) And when the pages are made public ( 11 ) And when the sky is stripped away
( 12 ) And when Hellfire is set ablaze
( 13 ) And when Paradise is brought near,
( 14 ) A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].
At-Takwir – No. 81 – verses 1 - 14
Allah depict some incidents of the Resurrection Day only in these verses:
( 41 ) And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -
( 42 ) The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
( 43 ) Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination
( 44 ) On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
Qaf – No. 50 – verses 41 – 44
Allah summarize the two days together in these verses:
( 68 ) And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.
( 69 ) And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.
( 70 ) And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.
Az Zumar – No. 39 – verses 68 – 70

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And when will be the last Day of this world where all aspects of life will be eradicated and all humans will be dead?
chunks.answer:
The answer is in the following verses:
( 187 ) They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."
Al A'raf – no. 7 – verse 187
( 42 ) They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?
( 43 ) In what [position] are you that you should mention it? ( 44 ) To your Lord is its finality.
( 45 ) You are only a warner for those who fear it.
( 46 ) It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
An Nazi'at – no. 79 – verse 42 - 46 Explanation:
In both verses, Allah confirm that the knowledge of the Last Day or the Hour is unseen. Only Allah know it. And it will come unexpectedly.
In the second verse, Allah allude to the fact that when people are resurrected, they will feel that their life on Earth was a very short one. They will feel as if they spent on Earth only one afternoon or one morning!

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: Are there any signs for the Last Day? Can we know or expect when the Last Day will start?
chunks.answer:
Yes, there are many signs for the Last Day that were mentioned in many "Hadeeths" narrated by prophet Muhammad. These Hadeeths are found in all Sunnah books. But these remain as only signs. No one knows how or when they will happen. One of these Hadeeths is the following:
Hudhaifa b. Usaid al-Ghifari reported:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came to us all of a sudden as we were (busy in a discussion). He said: What do you discuss about? They (the Companions) said. We are discussing about the Last Hour.
Thereupon he said: It will not come until you see ten signs before and (in this connection) he made a mention of the smoke, Dajjal, the beast, the rising of the sun from the west, the descent of Jesus son of Mary (Allah be pleased with him), the Gog and Magog, and land-slides in three places, one in the east, one in the west and one in Arabia at the end of which fire would burn forth from the Yemen, and would drive people to the place of their assembly.
Sahih Muslim 2901 a - In-book reference : Book 54, Hadith 51
It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
"Hasten to do good deeds (before) six things (happen): The rising of the sun from the west (place of its setting), the smoke, the beast of the earth, Dajjal (False Christ), that which will happen to each of you (death); and that which will happen to all people (the Day of Resurrection)."
Sunan Ibn Majah 4056 - In-book reference - Book 36, Hadith 131
Explanation: people may ask many questions about how and when and where these signs will start. But, in fact, this is part of the unseen that we should believe in without many questions.
You can understand more details if you refer to the explanation of these hadeeths in Sunnah books.

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And when will be the Resurrection Day where Allah will resurrect the dead for the Final Judgment?
chunks.answer: If the Last day is unknown to us so is the Resurrection Day. The timing of both of them is completely unknown to humans, messengers and even angels. Allah only know the time. But the Last Day and the Resurrection Day will come in a row as explained previously.

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: Do you know how much time there is between the two great days: The Final Day of the World and the Resurrection Day?
chunks.answer:
Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) gives you part of the answer in this hadeeth:
Narrated Abu Huraira:The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Between the two blowing of the trumpet there will be forty." The people said, "O Abu Huraira! Forty days?" I refused to reply. They said, "Forty years?" I refused to reply and added: Everything of the human body will decay except the coccyx bone (of the tail) and from that bone Allah will reconstruct the whole body.
Al-Bukhary - Book 65, Hadith 4814

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And what is going to happen in this unknown time between the two great days?
chunks.answer:
Allah will cause a specific kind of rain to come down from the sky. From this rain the bodies of human beings will be created again.
Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) explained this in the following hadeeth:
"……Then Allah would cause the water to, descend from the sky and they (people) will sprout like vegetable. The only thing in a man which would not decay would be one bone (the tailbone) from which the whole frame would be reconstituted on the Day of Resurrection."
Muslim - Book 54, Hadith 177

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And what are the dead people doing in their graves until the Last Day and the Resurrection Day? Do they feel the time passing? Do they have any kind of consciousness or any level of life?
chunks.answer:
The dead people have a level of life which is known only by Allah. It is like a spiritual life without a body. It is similar to what happens when you see a dream while sleeping. They do not feel the time passing. It is similar to someone who sleeps deeply for nine or ten hours and loses the time consciousness and then he wakes up suddenly. He thinks that he slept for only one hour or less because he lost the time awareness while sleeping. The same happens with the dead people. And Allah know the details best of course.
Many Haddeths describe this kind of life in graves. These are some of them:
Abu Hurairah narrated that:
The Messenger of Allah said: "When the deceased - or he said when one of you - is buried, two angels, black and blue (eyed_ come to him. One of them is called Al-Munkar, and the other An-Nakir. They say: 'What did you used to say about this man?' So he says what he was saying (before death) 'He is Allah's slave and His Messenger. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.' So they say: 'We knew that you would say this.' Then his grave is expanded to seventy by seventy cubits, then it is illuminated for him. Then it is said to him: 'Sleep.' So he said: 'Can I return to my family to inform them?' They say: 'Sleep as a newlywed, whom none awakens but the dearest of his family.' Until Allah resurrects him from his resting place. "If he was a hypocrite he would say: 'I heard people saying something, so I said the same; I do not know.' So they said: 'We knew you would say that.' So the earth is told: 'Constrict him.' So it constricts around him, squeezing his ribs together. He continues being punished like that until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."
Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1071 - In-book reference : Book 10, Hadith 107
Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:
Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, "When a dead body is placed on a bier and men carry it on their shoulders, if the deceased was pious, it (the corpse) will say: 'Take me in haste'; but if he was not, it will say (to its bearers): 'Woe to it. Where are you taking it?' Everything except man hears its voice. Had a human being heard its voice, he would have surely died".
Al- Bukhari - Arabic/English book reference: Book 1, Hadith 444 Riyad as-Salihin 444 : Reference
These are some news from the prophet about what happens to the dead, but the details and the realities of what happen remain as a part of the unseen that we should believe in. For example, you may say, how the corpse will speak? My brief answer is: Allah is all- powerful and omnipotent. It is easy for Him to make anything speak.

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And how will the Resurrection Day start? How will Allah resurrect the billions of dead people at the same time?
chunks.answer:
The details and the secrets of how this will happen are part of the unseen. No one knows how the resurrection will happen as no one knows how the creation of man and the universe was made. But Allah gave us in Qur'an and Sunnah some hints and allusions about how this will happen.
Here are some verses and Hadeeths:
( 11 ) And who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth
Az Zukhruf – no. 43 – verse 16
Abu Huraira said, "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "…	Allah will
send water from the sky and then the dead bodies will grow like vegetation grows, There is nothing of the human body that does not
decay except one bone; that is the little bone at the end of the coccyx of which the human body will be recreated on the Day of Resurrection." (See Hadith No. 338)
Al-Bukhary - Book 65, Hadith 4935
'A'isha reported that she heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying:
The people would be assembled on the Day of Resurrection barefooted, naked and uncircumcised. I said: Allah's Messenger, will the male and the female be together on the Day and would they be looking at one another? Upon this Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 'A'isha, the matter would be too serious for them to look to one another.
Sahih Muslim 2859 a - Book 53, Hadith 67

chunks.question: So, when Allah resurrect all these billions of humans from different ages, different generations and nationalities out of their graves at the same time. How will they feel? How will the situation be like? What will they say to each other? Describe this day in more detail- from Qur’an if you can.
chunks.answer:
The following verses describe these terrible moments:
( 51 ) And the Horn will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.
( 52 ) They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."
( 53 ) It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.
( 54 ) So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
Ya Sin – no. 36 – verse 51 – 54
( 7 ) Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
( 8 ) Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
Al Qamar – no.54 – verse 7 – 8
( 102 ) The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.
( 103 ) They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."
( 104 ) We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."
Ta Ha – no. 20 – verse 102 - 104

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: How long will the Resurrection and Judgement Day last? What are the main stages of this Day in brief?
chunks.answer:
Allah answered the duration of the Resurrection and Judgement Day in the Qur’an:

"A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen. To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer. [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent. The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years."
Al-Ma‘arij – no. 70 – verses 1–4

The stages of this Day can be summarized as follows, starting from death in this worldly life until eternal residence in Paradise or Hellfire:

1. **Spiritual life in the grave (Barzakh):** Humans will experience a form of spiritual life similar to the state of sleeping and dreaming. Each person’s experience will depend on his deeds in worldly life. The full details of this stage belong to the unseen, but the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) gave indications of it in authentic hadiths.

2. **The first blowing of the trumpet:** All living beings in the heavens and the earth will die, and life will completely cease.

"And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on."
Az-Zumar – no. 39 – verse 68

The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
"How can I be comfortable when the one with the Horn has placed it to his mouth, listening for when he will be commanded to blow it?"
(Jamiʿ at-Tirmidhi 2431 – Hasan)

3. **The period between the two trumpets:** Its duration is unknown. Allah will send a special rain from the sky, from which all human bodies—from Adam until the last human—will grow again without souls.

4. **The second blowing of the trumpet and Resurrection:** Souls will return to their bodies, graves will open, and all humans will rise and be driven by angels toward the land of the Final Gathering.

5. **Gathering and waiting for a long time**
6. **Receiving the record of deeds**
7. **Reckoning (Hisab)**
8. **The Scale (Mizan)**
9. **The Pool of Al-Kawthar**
10. **Crossing the Sirat**
11. **Intercession (Shafa‘ah)**
12. **Eternal residence in Paradise or Hellfire**

Further details of these stages are mentioned throughout the Qur’an and the authentic Sunnah, and are also illustrated in diagram no. 9 (p. 278) at the end of this book.

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: What is Paradise? What is it like? Where is it? And how will life be there?
chunks.answer:
Paradise (Jannah) is the eternal home prepared by Allah for the believers who had faith and performed righteous deeds. The Qur’an and the authentic Sunnah provide clear descriptions that give a sufficient illustration of its nature and blessings.

Allah says:

"Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all kinds of fruits and forgiveness from their Lord, like those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given scalding water that will sever their intestines?"
Muhammad – no. 47 – verse 15

"The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is that beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is everlasting and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire."
Ar-Ra‘d – no. 13 – verse 35

"Whoever does an evil deed will not be recompensed except by its like, but whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer – those will enter Paradise, being provided for therein without account."
Ghafir – no. 40 – verse 40

"And those who have believed and done righteous deeds – We will surely assign to them lofty chambers in Paradise beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the righteous workers."
Al-‘Ankabut – no. 29 – verse 58

"Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds – they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging, wherein they will abide forever. They will not desire any transfer from it."
Al-Kahf – no. 18 – verses 107–108

Allah further describes the life of Paradise:

"On adorned thrones, reclining on them, facing one another. There will circulate among them youthful servants, with vessels, pitchers, and a cup from a flowing spring – no headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated – and fruits of what they choose, and the meat of fowl from whatever they desire. And for them are companions with large, beautiful eyes, like well-protected pearls, as a reward for what they used to do. They will not hear therein ill speech or sin – only the saying: ‘Peace, peace.’"
Al-Waqi‘ah – no. 56 – verses 15–26

The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) narrated that Allah said:

"I have prepared for My righteous servants what no eye has ever seen, no ear has ever heard, and no human heart has ever imagined, apart from what Allah has already informed you of."
Sahih Muslim 2824

In conclusion, Paradise is beyond full human comprehension. Its pleasures are eternal, its blessings never end, and its life is free from pain, sorrow, and death. A believer can learn more about Paradise by reflecting upon the Qur’an and the authentic Sunnah.

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: What is Hellfire? What is it like? Where is it? And how will life be there?
chunks.answer:
Hellfire (Jahannam) is the eternal abode prepared by Allah for those who disbelieved in Him, rejected His signs, and persisted in injustice and corruption. The Qur’an provides clear and vivid descriptions of Hellfire, its nature, and the condition of its inhabitants.

Allah says:

"And say: ‘The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills – let him believe; and whoever wills – let him disbelieve.’ Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds their faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place."
Al-Kahf – no. 18 – verse 29

Allah also says:

"And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination. When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up. It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, ‘Did there not come to you a warner?’ They will say, ‘Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said: Allah has not sent down anything; you are not but in great error.’ And they will say, ‘If only we had listened or reasoned, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze.’"
Al-Mulk – no. 67 – verses 6–10

Allah further says:

"Say: ‘Worship whatever you will besides Him.’ Say: ‘Indeed, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the clear loss.’ They will have canopies of Fire above them and canopies beneath them. By that Allah warns His servants. O My servants, then fear Me."
Az-Zumar – no. 39 – verses 15–16

And Allah describes the companions of Hellfire:

"And the companions of the left – what are the companions of the left? They will be in scorching fire and scalding water, and a shade of black smoke, neither cool nor beneficial. Indeed, they were before that indulging in luxury, and they persisted in great sin. And they used to say: ‘When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected, and our forefathers as well?’"
Al-Waqi‘ah – no. 56 – verses 41–48

In summary, Hellfire is a place of severe punishment, regret, and eternal loss for those who rejected faith after the truth was made clear to them. Its torment is continuous, its suffering is intense, and its inhabitants will live a life of humiliation and despair. Many additional descriptions of Hellfire are found throughout the Qur’an and in the authentic Sunnah of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: How long will paradise dwellers stay in it and how long will Hellfire dwellers stay in it?
chunks.answer:
Both will stay eternally. The only exception is that some believers will stay in Hellfire for some time only according to the amount of their sins in their earthly lives and then they will be taken back to paradise.
The following verses are a sufficient answer:
"( 106 ) As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.
( 107 ) [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.
( 108 ) And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and
the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted."
Hud – no. 11 – verse 106 – 108
"( 6 ) Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures."
Al Bayyinah– no. 98 – verse 6

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: Paradise dwellers will stay therein eternally. So, will they feel bored from paradise? Will they want to move to another place?
chunks.answer:
This is a logical question. Also, the answer is mentioned in Qur’an:
"( 107 ) Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,
( 108 ) Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer."
Al Kahf– no. 18 – verse 107 – 108

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: And why will hellfire dwellers stay therein forever. However, their time of sins and corruption in life was limited? Is this fair?
chunks.answer:
This is another logical question. Allah answered you in Qur’an:
"( 27 ) If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."
( 28 ) But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars."
Al An'am– no. 6 – verse 27 – 28
Allah state clearly in these verses that if He returned the disbelievers to life again, they would do the same deeds. This is why they deserve eternal torture. Allah know best definitely.

metadata.category: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire

chunks.type: Section E – Questions about the Last Day of this world, the Resurrection of the dead, the Final Day of Judgment and the eternal life in paradise or hellfire
chunks.question: Will all the hellfire dwellers stay therein eternally? Or will some of them be saved of its tortures and get back to paradise after a specific time?
chunks.answer:
Hopefully, many people who are in hellfire will be saved after specific times and will be sent to paradise. The length of their stay in hellfire will depend on their deeds and the amount of true belief in their hearts. Only Allah know the secrets of these matters of course. However, the only people who will stay therein eternally are the unbelievers.
These verses confirm the eternal stay of the disbelievers in hellfire:
( 64 ) Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.
( 65 ) Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.
( 66 ) The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger."
Al Ahzab – No.33 – verses 64 - 66
This long hadeeth sheds light on how many groups of people will be saved from Hell.
"	By One in Whose hand is my life, there will be none among
you more eager to claim a right than the believers on the Day of Resurrection for (saying their) brethren in the Fire who would say: O our Lord, they were fasting along with us, and praying and performing pilgrimage. It will be said to them: Take out those whom you recognize. Then their persons would be forbidden to the Fire; and they would take out a large number of people who had been overtaken by Fire up to the middle of the shank or up to the knees. They would then say: O our Lord I not one of those about whom Thou didst give us command remains in it. He will then say: Go back and bring out those in whose hearts you find good of the weight of a dinar Then they will take out a large number of people. Then they would say: O our Lord! we have not left anyone about whom You commanded us. He will then say: Go back and bring out those in whose hearts you find as much as half a dinar of good. Then they will take out a large number of people, and would say: O our Lord!
not one of those about whom Thou commanded us we have left in it. Then He would say: Go back and in whose heart, you find good to the weight of a particle bring him out. They would bring out a large number of people, and would then say: O our Lord, now we have not left anyone in it (Hell) having any good in him.
Sahih Muslim, Book 1, Hadith 361

chunks.type: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels
chunks.question: So how should a Muslim deal with adherents of other religions in general? What is Islam's stance about this?
chunks.answer:
A Muslim should deal with people of other religions in a nice, kind and fair way as long as they do not harm Muslims or kill them or fight with them.
And even if there was aggression from their side on Muslims, Muslims should not behave on an individual basis or take personal decisions of counter attack. This decision must be taken by the leaders like the president or the king or whoever is in power if it was relevant to a group of people or a whole society.
Harming or killing someone from a different religion is a major and dangerous sin in Islam.
The following verses give a clear idea about this concept:
( 8 ) Allah do not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them.
Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
( 9 ) Allah only forbid you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
Al Mumtahanah – no. 60 – verse 8, 9
Safwan reported from a number of Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the authority of their fathers who were relatives of each other.
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Beware, if anyone wrongs a contracting man, or diminishes his right, or forces him to work beyond his capacity, or takes from him anything without his consent, I shall plead for him on the Day of Judgment.
Sunan Abi Dawud 3052 - Book 20, Hadith 125
Narrated `Abdullah bin `Amr:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Whoever killed a Mu'ahid (a person who is granted the pledge of protection by the Muslims) shall not smell the fragrance of Paradise though its fragrance can be smelt at a distance of forty years (of traveling).
Sahih al-Bukhari 6914 - Book 87, Hadith 52
It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said: “Whoever kills a Mu'ahid who has the protection of Allah and the protection of his Messenger, will not smell the fragrance of Paradise, even though its fragrance may be detected from a distance of Seventy years.”
Sunan Ibn Majah - Book 21, Hadith 2789
Mu’ahad: means someone from other religions who live peacefully among Muslims.

chunks.type: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels
chunks.question: Who are my enemies in this life as a Muslim so that I can avoid them?
chunks.answer:
Yourself, Satan, the hypocrites, and anyone who discourages you from abiding by Islamic rules.
The following verses talk in more detail about this:
"( 53 ) And I do not acquit myself. Indeed, the soul is a persistent enjoiner of evil, except those upon which my Lord has mercy.
Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
Yusuf – no. 12 – verse 53
( 1 ) When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
( 2 ) They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
( 3 ) That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.
( 4 ) And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
Al Munafiqun– no. 63 – verse 1 - 4
Explanation: The verse refers to the hypocrites who pretend to be Muslims but in fact they hate Islam and hate Islamic rulings.
"Indeed Satan, to man, is a manifest enemy."
Yusuf – No. 12 – verse 5
"( 6 ) Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze." Fatir – no. 35 – verse 6
Explanation: The verse refers to "Satan" or "the devil" and his offspring who are clear enemies to humans.

metadata.category: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels

chunks.type: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels
chunks.question: And where is this "Satan" or "the devil"?
chunks.answer:
Satan and his offspring are there around us everywhere, but we do not see them. They are part of the "Unseen". And if you are still doubtful about the "Unseen", let me remind you that all kinds of viruses and bacteria that killed millions of people along human history were unseen, however, you believe in their existence and take medicines to protect yourself against their dangers:
"( 27 ) O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe."
Al A'raf– no. 7 – verse 27

metadata.category: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels

chunks.type: Section F – Main Topics: Questions about the righteous way. And about yourself in relation to other people, cultures, enemies, allies, Satan and the angels
chunks.question: Tell me more about "the devils" or "Satan"? Are there really devils that we cannot, see? What is Islam's stance about these creatures?
chunks.answer:
Devils are there. Devils are a section of " the Jinn", but devils are unbeliever Jinn. Those creatures are unseen by man. However, they can see us. They are everywhere. Allah created them for many reasons. One of them is to be "fitna" or "test" for humans. There is a long history of hatred and animosity between man and the devil.
There are various Qur'anic verses that tell us about this story.
I will cite for you a few of them and you can find the rest in Qur'an:
This was the first encounter between humans and "devils" when "Iblees" refused to prostrate to Adam:
( 34 ) And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate before Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.
Al Baqarah– no.2 – verse 34
Then, this important conversation happened between Allah and "Iblees" the leader or the father of "devils". In the end, Allah agreed to let him live until all the human race die so that he can mislead them. "Iblees swore by Allah to mislead all human beings except those sincere servants of Allah:
( 75 ) [Allah] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"
( 76 ) He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
( 77 ) [Allah] said, "Then get out of Paradise, for indeed, you are expelled.
( 78 ) And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."
( 79 ) He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
( 80 ) [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved ( 81 ) Until the Day of the time well-known."
( 82 ) [Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all ( 83 ) Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
Sad- no. 38 – verse 75 – 83
In this verse, Allah warn us not to follow the temptation of "Satan" or "Iblees" or the "devil" because if we follow his temptation, we will definitely be losers:
( 27 ) O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts.
Al A'raf– no. 7 – verse 27
In this verse, Allah explain for us that "Satan" and his children can see us whereas, we cannot:
Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, we have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.
Al A'raf– no. 7 – verse 27
In this verse – as in many others – Allah explain for us that "Satan' or "the devil" is a clear enemy for us and we should never worship him or obey him. We should always worship and obey Allah, our creator:

chunks.question: What about angels? What does Islam say about them? Are they really there?
chunks.answer:
Yes, angels are there. They are also unseen by humans. These are creatures made from light. Allah created them for doing so many different jobs. They never disobey Allah. They are always obedient. Some of them are high-rank angels like "Jabraiel" who used to bring Allah's revelation from the heavens down to Allah's messengers on earth. Another example is “the Death Angel”. This is the angel who is responsible for taking souls of humans when their life come to an end. Another example is "Rakeeb" and "Ateed". Those are two angels who accompany every human being throughout his life to register his good deeds and bad ones. There are so many others with different jobs. You can read about them in detail in Qur'an:
Here are some verses that talk about angels:
( 6 ) O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.

chunks.answer:
We should obey Allah and His messenger. We should obey Allah's rules and regulations in Qur'an and Sunnah. Then we should obey our scholars. And if they disagree about an incident, we should follow the opinion accepted by the majority of them. Then, we should obey our leaders, presidents or kings even if they were unfair. We should obey them as long as they do not prevent us from praying or order us to do things against our religion.

chunks.question: Who are the people whom Allah love most. Or who are the best and closest people to the creator? The richest, the most powerful, the smartest, the most beautiful or who?
chunks.answer:
Allah do not care about your wealth, your power, your beauty your smartness or your skills…etc. because all these are blessings from Him. He could deprive you from any of them whenever He want. Allah care only about your piety. He love those who are the most pious and here are the proofs from Qur'an and Sunnah:

chunks.question: Most people in this life compete and contend for accumulating wealth, fame, power and all life pleasures. But when we die, no one takes his property, money, children or authority What should I compete for? What will stay with me in my grave and in the eternal life?
chunks.answer:
Definitely right. Whatever one is rich and powerful, he enters his grave poor and helpless. Only your deeds accompany you in the grave. So, the right and wise competition should be in good deeds to win paradise not in world pleasures and possessions. Good deeds stay with you in the eternal life whereas world pleasures are temporary and deceiving.

chunks.question: But the fact is that most people in the world are controlled by their lusts and world pleasures like love of money, women, power…etc. How should a Muslim deal with such world pleasures and lusts?
chunks.answer:
These lusts and world pleasures were created by Allah intentionally to test people. If people spend their lives busy collecting money or enjoying other pleasures like children, women, businesses or power, they will be losers on the Last Day.
Allah warned us in many verses not to be busy with these pleasures and forget worshipping Allah or show little attention to Allah's orders.
Definitely it is permissible to have and enjoy these pleasures but with reasonable amounts which render you able to perform the main job you were created for. That is, worshipping Allah.
Here are some verses that present these facts:
( 14 ) Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.

Al 'Imran– no.3 – verse 14,15

chunks.question: What if I tell you that I am not convinced of all or most of what you said? And I will never convert to Islam?
chunks.answer:
It is all up to your discretion definitely. It is your free choice to believe or not to believe. I am only trying to explain the facts of Islam to you. Allah, the creator Himself gave humans the free choice to believe or not, but they will bear the consequences of their choice. They will be accountable.
The following verses illustrate these ideas:
"( 256 ) There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing."
Al Baqarah– no.2 – verse 256
"( 6 ) For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."
Al Kafirun– no. 109 – verse 6
"( 6 ) And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds."
Al 'Ankabut– no. 29 – verse 6
"( 44 ) Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing," Ar Rum– no. 30 – verse 44
Also, note that if you believe in Allah and his messenger and obey them in everything and spend all your life praying, this will not benefit Allah in anyway. Also, all your prayers and obedience will never add an atom to Allah's universe. Likewise, it will not benefit me in anyway either. The benefits will be for yourself only because Allah will grant you a happy life, much happier than the one you live right now. And you will feel the sweetness of believing in your heart. By believing, you will feel that your life has a target and has a meaning. You will recognize that life on Earth is only a short life for testing people and it is-definitely- followed by death and by another eternal life in the Hereafter. So, you will understand the true meaning of death. Also, you will not be sad or angry for anything you lose in this life because you will know that whatever happens to you is destined by Allah. Most important of all is that you will survive hellfire on the day of resurrection, and you will enjoy Paradise eternally in unimaginable blessings and happiness.
On the contrary, if you refuse Allah's true religion, you will be the only loser; as, you will lose real happiness in this life and eternal happy life in Paradise in the Hereafter. You will only live this life concerned about collecting money, eating, drinking and enjoying and then finally waiting for death and hellfire. This situation is, actually, very hateful, miserable and shameful.
Allah elucidate these facts in Qur’an conspicuously:
"( 7 ) If you disbelieve - indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts."
Az Zumar– no. 39 – verse 7
Allah describe the stark paradox between believers and unbelievers in the following verses:
"( 12 ) Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them."
Muhammad – no. 47 – verse 12

chunks.question: How can I confirm the authenticity of your answers and the accuracy of the information you told me?
chunks.answer:
There are many ways and different rubrics that can be used to verify the authenticity and accuracy of the information presented in this book. However, the following five methods are among the most logical and straightforward:

1- Select some of the important questions discussed in this book and search for answers to the same questions within your own religion or in other major religions you are familiar with. Then compare the answers carefully. Such comparison will reveal clear differences and highlight many important points.

2- If you are skeptical about some of what has been mentioned, raise your hands sincerely to the Creator and supplicate truthfully. You may say: "O You who created the heavens, the earth, humankind, and everything in existence, if Islam is the true religion, then guide me to it." Repeat this supplication sincerely, and Allah will guide you to the truth in one way or another.

3- Attempt to answer some of the challenging questions posed by Allah in the Qur’an. A list of these questions is provided at the end of this book. If you are able to answer them satisfactorily without embracing Islam, then the choice remains yours. (See page 251 for the full list.)

4- Randomly select some of the Qur’anic verses and Prophetic Hadeeths cited in this book and verify their authenticity using trusted and well-known sources of the Qur’an and Sunnah.

5- Confirm the accuracy of some of the historical events mentioned in this book by consulting well-established and reputable historical references and books.

chunks.question: Well, If I am thinking about converting to Islam, what is your advice for me?
chunks.answer:
My advice is, simply, that you should know that the essence of Islam is that you submit and surrender thoroughly to Allah's will and his messenger's instructions because whatever the knowledge you may possess, you will never be able to discern the wisdom and the real reasons behind everything Allah destined in this life. Your limited mind and senses will never be able to understand how and why everything happens in this world.
And if you insist on using your limited mind to understand everything and the wisdom behind it, your mind will fail you and you will find many incidents in this world meaningless. Your disability to understand why everything happens in this or that way may lead you to be an atheist as it led many millions of people before you.
Man is very limited in means of strength, knowledge and understanding. In the first pages of this book, you knew that you have no idea about your own soul which gives life to your body. Even, you have no idea how it leaves your body every day when you sleep and then comes back to your body without any control from your side. All the modern sciences with its technology and labs do not know anything or have any control on the soul either. The soul is just a simple example.
And if you look around you, you will find hundreds but thousands of examples for Allah's powers and creation. At the same time, you will find hundreds but thousands of examples for man's weakness, ignorance and inability to control his own body or the world around him. So, do not let your mind fool you and do not let the little knowledge that you have mislead you. Submit to Allah completely and say what Allah taught us to say in this verse:
" And they say, "We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination."
Al Baqarah– no. 2 – verse 285

chunks.question: Should I leave my mind aside in everything and just follow the Islamic legislation blindly? Which areas can I use my mind in? And which areas must I follow the Islamic legislation in confidently and blindly?
chunks.answer:
No, definitely not. Do not leave your mind aside. Use your mind in what it was created for. Use it to manage your life, job and everyday needs. Use it to know and recognize your creator's greatness and understand His book to you. But do not use it to understand things which are beyond your mind's limits like destiny, and why this happens and why this doesn't happen. And why Allah made this in such a specific way, etc.…….
If you can understand some of the wisdom behind Allah's actions, it is okay and good. If you can't – and this will happen frequently – say: "I believe in Allah and trust Him." By this way only you can live happily and peacefully in the middle of this tumultuous life and win eternal paradise in the Hereafter.

chunks.question: How do you see the future of Islam? Do you think its followers will increase or decrease? Do you think it will be the overwhelming religion in the world?
chunks.answer:
Islam is the true religion of Allah. And the true religion of Allah must win and be the overwhelming one. It will not necessarily have the greatest number of followers. But it will surely be the powerful and the winner one day. This is Allah's promise in Qur'an. But this will happen when Muslims abide by Qur'an regulations and follow their messenger. Muslims became powerful and winners when they followed the instructions of Qur’an and Sunnah. And this will not happen again unless they follow Qur’an and Sunnah again. Allah’s rules never change.
The following verses confirm that Allah’s religion must be the winner and the most powerful one day against the will of the unbelievers:
"( 32 ) They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it."
